These calculations are based on double what the cart would be making at the Portland location: The justification for doubling everything is to take into consideration that the hours will increase by extending them to double and triple the original hours. These hours and the percentage that the host business will earn will depend upon the contracts established between both parties.

As stated, the N.E. Portland cart showed a profit margin of approx. $250.00 a day between the months of Feb-thru-June of 2014 and the hours were extremely limited. This is with weekday traffic of 5000 people. "According to ODOT, average daily traffic (ADT) up the mountain is 8,500 from Rhododendron, 14 to 17 percent of which are trucks" Hungry bored truck drivers will also stop, and most likely become some of our best customers.

So, subtracting the 17-percent, the ADT = 7055 PER DAY. That's 71% more traffic than the 5000 I am basing my calculations upon. (This doesn't even include those trucks that will stop at my cart.) And with a name like Wendy's Wieners, they'll stop just to ask me "What the heck are you doing?!" Having fun!

(http://ntl.bts.gov/lib/48000/48500/48580/TAG_US... - from "Transportation Observations, Considerations, and Recommendations for Mt. Hood National Forest").

Summarizing: In this 27.3 mile stretch of the Mount Hood Highway, ATD ranges from 8,500 vehicles in any 24-hour period to a high of 26,200

Traffic near Mt. Hood is shown to be growing exponentially with an increase of about 25-30% each year and no signs of slowing down. These numbers are verifiable through the ODOT link below.

For U.S. 26 (Mt. Hood Highway) between Sandy and Government Camp:

2013 Transportation Volume Tables, ODOT, http://www.oregon.gov/ODOT/TD/TDATA/tsm/docs/TVT_2013.pdf

story:
The Statistics tell the story...

  • There are over 2 million people incarcerated in the United States, best estimate is 10% of them are veterans
  • There are over 2.3 million American veterans of the Iraq and Afghanistan wars at least 20% of Iraq and Afghanistan veterans have PTSD and/or Depression.
  • An estimated 460,000 veterans suffer from PTSD.
  • Over 260,000 veterans from Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom so far have been diagnosed with TBI (Traumatic Brain Injury).
  • There are 300,000 homeless veterans sleeping on the streets…and 1.4 million at the risk of becoming homeless.
  • Veterans have to wait months for an initial doctors appointment.
  • The Veterans Administration have resources to serve only fractions of our veterans.
  • Nearly 5000 veterans die by their own hands every year…that’s one veteran every 2 hours.

Who is Conviction Customs?

Conviction Customs will be a independently owned motorcycle shop, who will provide all ranges of service and custom on-off motorcycle builds.  Conviction  Customs will also serve as an online retailer for used parts, focusing on primarily sportbikes. CC will also be an online dealer for other accessories and apparel related to the motorcycle and powersport community. CC’s physical location will provide full service work, performance modifications and restoration to the Jacksonville and surrounding communities. CC will only be staffed by ex-convicts, primarily military veteran ex-convicts, as a way to provide these people the ability to rebuild their lives. Portions of CC’s profits will also go to The Conviction House, Inc; which provides support services to ex-convict military veterans.

This campaign is more then just opening a small business.  It's about providing the ability to fund a non-profit organization to provide help to warriors like myself who have ended up on the wrong side of the law due to problems related to Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder.  Right now, there are approximately 200,000 Veterans incarcerated, which is around 10% of the U.S.'s incarcerated population.  

Conviction Customs will build four custom motorcycles each year and raffle them off at the following events:  Sturgis, Laconia, Daytona Bike Week and Daytona Biketoberfest.  Approximately 1,000,000 people attend Daytona Bike Week each year.  A survey was recently conducted and concluded that 60% of people surveyed would purchase a $5 raffle ticket for a custom motorcycle.  The proceeds of these raffles would directly benefit The Conviction House.

The Conviction House goal is to provide support services to incarcerated / previously incarcerated Veterans, Veterans convicted of felonies directly related to PTSD / TBI, and homeless Veterans.  We will also provide support to non-veteran incarcerated persons and person convicted of felonies on a case by case basis.  The aim is to provide services such as support groups, counseling, employment screening and placement and educational services.  Once enough funding has been accumulated for The Conviction House, we would like to establish per-deim based housing for homeless Veterans and Veterans being released from incarceration.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds produced from contributions will go directly to start-up cost associated with starting Conviction Customs.  Conviction Customs will start out as an Ebay retailer of quality used motorcycle parts obtained by parting out motorcycles purchased from the community.  CC will also be a vendor/dealer for several companies that produce custom parts and apparel related to the powersport community.  Our physical location will provide full service work, performance modifications and restoration to the Jacksonville and surrounding communities.

Specifically we will need $50,000 to start up.  These funds will be used to lease our physical location, do legal filings, purchase tools, acquire initial motorcycle inventory for parts, initial apparel and accessories inventory; and lastly initial payroll.  We will be using funds from contributions first to file our Limited Liability Company paperwork through LegalZoom.com, though Conviction Customs is already a registered DBA in the State of Florida.  Here is a break down of the start-up cost expected:

EXPENSE START UP
Van $3,500.00
Vehicle Insurance $75.00
Warehouse Rent $3,000.00
Shelving $200.00
Motorcycles $9,000.00
Inventory $5,000.00
Tools $5,000.00
Marketing $1,000.00
Cleaning Supplies $500.00
Laptop $300.00
Camera $100.00
Legal Fees $500.00
Utilities $100.00
Cellphone $200.00
Office Supplies $200.00
Operating Expenses $5,000.00
Total $33,675.00
With one motorcycle parted out Conviction Customs can make a gross profit of $3716.00.  Starting out Conviction Customs will be able to handle a volume of 3 part out motorcycles per month.

VARIABLE EXPENSE YEAR 1
Motorcycle Cost $3,000.00
Ebay Fee ($0.25 @ 35 items) $8.75
Gas ($3 a gallon @ 100 mi 15 mpg) $20.00
Cleaning Chemicals $5.00
Paint $5.00
Marketing $15.00
Total Variable Cost $3,053.75
Gross Profit $3,716.25
Conviction Customs anticipates making a total profit of $44,738.25 in the first year.

The Impact

The impact Conviction Customs in partnership with The Conviction House is tremendous.  Currently, well known Veteran's support organizations are denying help to this under-known segment of the Veteran population.  I have attempted to register with several organizations that are well known to help and support Veterans with visible and non-visible wounds such as PTSD and TBI, and have been turned down by everyone because of my background.  The other Veterans who stood up to protect this country will face the same challenges as they attempt to get their lives back together.

Here are links to stories around the country, to include my own story, that show how PTSD is impacting our Veterans and how many Veterans have found themselves incarcerated.

My story:

http://hamptonroads.com/node/191621

http://www.dailykos.com/story/2006/08/20/238373/-The-Breaking-of-a-Marine#

Other Stories:

http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2013/07/28/from-ptsd-to-prison-why-veterans-become-criminals.html

This Marine Corps Veteran served 17 years and is now incarcerated for 16 years due to actions directly related to PTSD: http://time.com/2873/a-troubled-marines-final-fight/

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out about this campaign using social media and word of mouth.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
The Statistics tell the story...

There are over 2 million people incarcerated in the United States, best estimate is 10% of them are veterans
There are over 2.3 million American veterans of the Iraq and Afghanistan wars at least 20% of Iraq and Afghanistan veterans have PTSD and/or Depression.
An estimated 460,000 veterans suffer from PTSD.
Over 260,000 veterans from Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom so far have been diagnosed with TBI (Traumatic Brain Injury).
There are 300,000 homeless veterans sleeping on the streets…and 1.4 million at the risk of becoming homeless.
Veterans have to wait months for an initial doctors appointment.
The Veterans Administration have resources to serve only fractions of our veterans.
Nearly 5000 veterans die by their own hands every year…that’s one veteran every 2 hours.


Who is Conviction Customs?

Conviction Customs will be a independently owned motorcycle shop, who will provide all ranges of service and custom on-off motorcycle builds.  Conviction  Customs will also serve as an online retailer for used parts, focusing on primarily sportbikes. CC will also be an online dealer for other accessories and apparel related to the motorcycle and powersport community. CC’s physical location will provide full service work, performance modifications and restoration to the Jacksonville and surrounding communities. CC will only be staffed by ex-convicts, primarily military veteran ex-convicts, as a way to provide these people the ability to rebuild their lives. Portions of CC’s profits will also go to The Conviction House, Inc; which provides support services to ex-convict military veterans.

story:
Be the first to try our spice rubs (seasonings) and small batch BBQ sauces.

Order by clicking on the 'perk' that best suits your budget.
All perks include postage within Australia ($5 more worldwide)
We have two rub flavours: Mind Your Own Brisket (pepper) and Howdy Amigo (tex-mex) - and three sauce flavours: Original BBQ, Roughneck BBQ & Hot Sauce (plus more surprises if we get creative in the mean time)
Money made from this campaign will go towards the set up cost of selling our products commercially. 
Read on for more:

Crystal Palm

Thanks for checking out Crystal Palm. We need some help to get our products into production and have some great perks on offer to show our appreciation

I have developed a range of spice rubs and small batch BBQ sauces that make cooking during a busy week easy, fun and flavourful; and barbecues enjoyable and impressive for all.

I want to give the versatility and simplicity that these products bring to my household, to the rest of Australia, and the world.

By contributing to this campaign you can get stuck into these flavours immediately and set Crystal Palm on its journey to becoming synonymous with fun & flavour in Australian homes and backyards.

Scroll through the list of perks on the right and click to make them yours. 

Check our recipe blog for ideas http://crystalpalm.blog.com/

What We Need & What You Get

We have been developing our spice rubs and sauces since I got back from southern USA trip in 2013. We were using our sauce in a market stall in Alice Springs and selling bottled sauces there until I had to move interstate with my family. Crystal Palm is now in a position to get its cooking companions on the market and out to you! All we need is a little help to strengthen that position financially.

We need funding for ingredients, packaging, marketing and small business overheads. Funds will ensure the process of production and getting to market will be swift and efficient. If we do not reach our goal we will still get our rubs onto the market eventually, but the process will likely be slower and need to involve private investors.

Part of this funding goes directly to the super perks available to contributors.

All contributors will be kept in the loop, via email, as we develop our business and range of products. You will be the first to know about new products, new recipes, sales & promotional events. 

All Austalian based contributors of at least $10 will be mailed product samples to use at home or share with their friends.

Spice Rubs - although we call them 'spice rubs' these products are much more versatile than just for rubbing on meat. You could call them flavour packs when you add them to stir fries, salads or sauces. Or you might term them spice sprinkles when you dust them on vegetables, a lean steak or chicken breast before searing. We are in the habit of calling them spice rubs because their original intention was to be massaged into meat before barbecuing low and slow over charcoal and wood fires. Regardless of what you decided to name them once you get them home their versatility is peerless in Australian owned and made products. 

Our spice rubs are hand blended and packaged in 100g bags, in Gracemere, Australia. They contain no sugar or salt, no preservatives and no anti-caking agents. They come in two flavours: 

Mind Your Own Brisket is a pepper and paprika based rub that is best on beef products and adds zing to veggies or salads. The pepper is by no means overpowering, but does all it can to enhance the flavours in the cut of beef, or other meat, you choose. 

Howdy Amigo is a texmex based rub that is best with chicken and pork. It has a stronger flavour that brings the fiesta to any meal. It can be added to meals before, during or after cooking to impress varying pallets. For those who like hotter texmex food you can add your own fresh or dried chilis to ramp up the heat.

Small Batch BBQ Sauces - Our small batch BBQ sauces are hand made and bottled in Gracemere, Australia in batches of 5 x 270g bottles. We use Australian ingredients where possible, and add no salt or preservatives. The sauces are versatile Texas style BBQ sauces with definite Australian infusions, They can be used for marinating, basting, braising, or as a condiment. Every sauce uses tomato and vinegar as a base and then we have a great time adding Aussie flavours and seasonal ingredients. Each batch is slightly different from the next but we enjoy that as part of the fun. In your perk pack you will receive a random selection of the batches we have available unless otherwise stated. We do have three sauces that we keep to a reasonably consistent recipe though:

Original BBQ - Born in the tradition of tomato based Texan BBQ sauces but with the addition of distinctly Australian ingredients. It steers away from being placed in any particular BBQ sauce category. Will please the palates of most BBQ connoisseurs.
Roughneck BBQ - A slight tweak on the Crystal Palm’s Original BBQ sauce to give a more savoury flavour. It has a richness of flavour that complements darker meats and low & slow cooking.

Hot Sauce - Born out of the same tomato base as Crystal Palm’s BBQ sauces, this chilli sauce packs extra flavour along with its chili zing. It is sure to enhance rather than overpower any meal for those that like a bit of bite. Chili rating: medium – hot 

Other promotional material - 
T-Shirts - Throwback style greywash tees with a small logo on the front and large logo on the back. I'll contact you for your size.
Stubby Holder - can cooler, echo holder, coozi. Another product with many names but this one will just keep your drinks cold while cooking or Qing. White with logo and website on one side. Flattens completely so fits easily in your (apron) pocket. Also has a bottom so those European type beer bottles don't fall through.

Masterclass - The is an opportunity to see Crystal Palm's spice rubs and sauces used firsthand in your own home. I will happily cook in your home or at another negotiated location for you and six friends to show you how easy it is to use our products and how great they taste. You can be involved in the cooking as much as you like and I can adapt our recommended recipes to whatever cooking apparatus you utilise at home, inside or out. We will need to meet prior to negotiate a date and discuss menus, food and cooking specifications. All ingredients, 1 x 100g spice rub for you and your guests, and travel up to 100km from Gracemere is included in this perk. Cost of further travel +/- accommodation will need to be negotiated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, and I understand that, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share this campaign with your friends who may be interested in trying our products - use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Follow us on social media and 'like' our content to boost visibility
If you have any queries or concerns please don't hesitate to contact us.
Happy Cooking and Qing everyone!

Tristan

story: Born on the beautiful Caribbean island of SVG . Growing up with strong hardworking women made me want to be great. My food is fun, festive, full of flavor , it will warm your hearts and stomach. I hope to be a food network chef one day , with hard work and dedication and of course God working through me I will succeed.

story:
J O U R N E Y


T h e  C h a r g e

It’s time to change the world! That’s why you came to our page isn’t it?  Well, we are excited to give you an opportunity to do so.  But, in case you weren’t driven here by your overwhelming desire to save all of mankind from impending doom I should probably give you a bit of background on who we are, how it is we are planning to accomplish our mission, and where you fit in to all of this.


T h e  B a c k g r o u n d

My name is Michael Ling.  My amazing wife Judy and I have been married for eleven years. Those eleven years have produced one handsome son, one beautiful daughter (my daddy’s girl), a young God fearing woman that we have adopted as our own and our faithful dog Bell.  These years have also birthed and grown in us a desire to see people healed from the hurt and pain that have followed and burdened them throughout their lives. 

While I have worked with animals for the past sixteen years, just recently having changed our scenery from where we were born and raised in Southern California to accept an exciting job offer as the administrator for a group of veterinarian hospitals in North Las Vegas, my heart is and has always been for all things film. To the smallest name at the end of the credits to the biggest name on the marquee, the impact that movies create in each and every heart and mind have inspired me for as long as I can remember. This brings us to our “Journey.”  Journey Entertainment Studios is the culmination of my love for all things film and our overwhelming burden to share true stories with the world, bringing hope and healing to others who may relate to the heartaches and triumphs of our movies.  Since its inception eight years ago we have written, acted in, produced and directed our own projects and have been hired by others to do the same.  Our dream is to make life altering, impactful films on a full time basis.


T h e  M i s s i o n

At “Journey” we don’t believe that making movies is enough.  There are many different studios that create movies specifically for entertainment purposes and we applaud them.  We all need to get away to another world and another time.  Here at Journey Entertainment Studios we know that many times for millions of people that getting away is not enough.  People need hope.  They need to see that no matter where they are at they are loved and valued.  They need to see that there are people that have overcome the situations that they are in right at that moment and in their mourning there can be joy.  They can overcome.  God loves them and has a plan for them to prosper.  That’s where we come in. We are committed to not only making movies that showcase real life stories and their circumstances but also in giving a percentage of the proceeds to avenues of intervention already created to assist those who have not yet found their freedom from the afflictions in which they are plagued.  


T h e  C o n c e r n

Domestic violence is a brutal and widely underreported crime that affects over 12 million women and men over the course of a year. Twenty-four people per minute are victims of rape, physical violence or stalking by an intimate partner in the United States. Nearly 3 in 10 women (29%) and 1 in 10 men (10%) in the US have experienced rape, physical violence and/or stalking by a partner and report a related impact on their functioning. Almost half of all women and men in the United States have experienced psychological aggression by an intimate partner in their lifetime. (48.4% and 48.8% respectively) The astounding numbers reported here from The National Domestic Violence Hotline are why our first feature length film will be tackling this despairing subject.  We feel compelled to reach as many people as possible with a real life story of the hopelessness, heartbreak and destruction of a relationship riddled with domestic violence to the restoration of joy, peace and a prosperous future through the healing power of God’s love. 


T h e  C a m p a i g n

We now come to where the rubber meets the road.  This is where you come in.  We are looking to partner with people to reach our goal of $20,000 to turn this script into the impactful movie it promises to be.  I know what you are thinking. What will $20,000 allow us to do and is that even enough money to make a movie? Let me begin by saying that we have already put countless hours and thousands of dollars of our own into making this a reality. All of the money that we are seeking will go towards production and marketing for the film. We will be paying for the actors, equipment, sound engineer, make-up artist, and locations.  I will be wearing the producer and director hat for the film. I have experience directing and producing on multiple productions, including a movie that premiered at Camelot Theater in Palm Springs, California. Another way we are able to make a quality film with a low budget is by being selective in theaters. By utilizing a central theater in each geographic location instead showing in every theater in every city we will still have the exposure that we seek while maintaining a low overhead. Along with these processes we have a solid marketing plan and established relationships with associates from many different forms of media, including television and radio. While we are confident that we will meet or exceed our goal, we believe in having a plan B.  Rest assured that whatever amount we raise will be used to create this film and get it to the big screen.  As they say, ‘the show must go on.’ As a bonus to giving to a worthy cause and bringing a dark subject into the light, we have gifts and incentives in appreciation to your generosity, including having your own cameo in the film. 


T h e  I m p a c t

Your contribution is not only going forward to assist in the creation of a movie that is going to open eyes to the reality and oppression of domestic violence and give hope to those who are victims of this terrible affliction, but also to an established organization that has taken over 3 million calls in the 20 years since its inception.  We have partnered up with The National Domestic Violence Hotline to impact the lives of those attempting to get assistance for or flee from dangerous and violent homes.  We have pledged 10% of the total profits of the movie to thehotline.org. Since 1996, the National Domestic Violence Hotline has been a vital link to safety for women, men, children and families affected by domestic violence. With the help of their dedicated advocates and staff, they respond to calls 24/7, 365 days a year. They provide confidential, one-on-one support to each caller and chatter, offering crisis intervention, options for next steps and direct connection to sources for immediate safety. Their database holds over 5,000 agencies and resources in communities all across the country.  They have bilingual staff on hand to answer calls and their Language Line offers translations in over 170 different languages.  Talk about impact.  Along with our commitment of 10% of the total profits, our trailer and movie will feature The National Domestic Violence Hotline’s contact information. 


T h e  W r a p – u p

There are obviously no shortage of individuals looking to get funded for their projects, many of whom are seeking finances for other great causes and burdens. What makes us different from them?  Why should you give to us?  Well, some of you that read this know and love us.  We love you too and thank you for giving. Many of you, however, don’t know us at all.  We understand that. Let me tell you why you should partner with us. This is what we know about you. With such alarming statistics it is a guarantee that many of you reading this right now have deep wounds from firsthand experience with domestic violence.  Another handful of visitors here have cousins, or sisters, maybe even roommates that you believe are being abused in their relationships. Some of you right now are currently living in fear and hopelessness in a home where domestic violence is a daily occurrence. There are so many afflicted and yet the amount of attention domestic violence gets is staggeringly small.  Here’s a chance to make a difference. Help us to help someone before it is too late. Partner with us and The National Domestic Violence Hotline. Join us on our journey to change the world starting right here with this film. There may be some reading this that absolutely don’t have the means to give financially but have read this and feel compelled to intervene in some way.  Please be praying for us and our project. Even more so, pray for those in violent and abusive relationships.
story_txt:
J O U R N E Y



T h e  C h a r g e
It’s time to change the world! That’s why you came to our page isn’t it?  Well, we are excited to give you an opportunity to do so.  But, in case you weren’t driven here by your overwhelming desire to save all of mankind from impending doom I should probably give you a bit of background on who we are, how it is we are planning to accomplish our mission, and where you fit in to all of this.

T h e  B a c k g r o u n d
My name is Michael Ling.  My amazing wife Judy and I have been married for eleven years. Those eleven years have produced one handsome son, one beautiful daughter (my daddy’s girl), a young God fearing woman that we have adopted as our own and our faithful dog Bell.  These years have also birthed and grown in us a desire to see people healed from the hurt and pain that have followed and burdened them throughout their lives. 
While I have worked with animals for the past sixteen years, just recently having changed our scenery from where we were born and raised in Southern California to accept an exciting job offer as the administrator for a group of veterinarian hospitals in North Las Vegas, my heart is and has always been for all things film. To the smallest name at the end of the credits to the biggest name on the marquee, the impact that movies create in each and every heart and mind have inspired me for as long as I can remember. This brings us to our “Journey.”  Journey Entertainment Studios is the culmination of my love for all things film and our overwhelming burden to share true stories with the world, bringing hope and healing to others who may relate to the heartaches and triumphs of our movies.  Since its inception eight years ago we have written, acted in, produced and directed our own projects and have been hired by others to do the same.  Our dream is to make life altering, impactful films on a full time basis.

T h e  M i s s i o n
At “Journey” we don’t believe that making movies is enough.  There are many different studios that create movies specifically for entertainment purposes and we applaud them.  We all need to get away to another world and another time.  Here at Journey Entertainment Studios we know that many times for millions of people that getting away is not enough.  People need hope.  They need to see that no matter where they are at they are loved and valued.  They need to see that there are people that have overcome the situations that they are in right at that moment and in their mourning there can be joy.  They can overcome.  God loves them and has a plan for them to prosper.  That’s where we come in. We are committed to not only making movies that showcase real life stories and their circumstances but also in giving a percentage of the proceeds to avenues of intervention already created to assist those who have not yet found their freedom from the afflictions in which they are plagued.  

T h e  C o n c e r n
Domestic violence is a brutal and widely underreported crime that affects over 12 million women and men over the course of a year. Twenty-four people per minute are victims of rape, physical violence or stalking by an intimate partner in the United States. Nearly 3 in 10 women (29%) and 1 in 10 men (10%) in the US have experienced rape, physical violence and/or stalking by a partner and report a related impact on their functioning. Almost half of all women and men in the United States have experienced psychological aggression by an intimate partner in their lifetime. (48.4% and 48.8% respectively) The astounding numbers reported here from The National Domestic Violence Hotline are why our first feature length film will be tackling this despairing subject.  We feel compelled to reach as many people as possible with a real life story of the hopelessness, heartbreak and destruction of a relationship riddled with domestic violence to the restoration of joy, peace and a prosperous future through the healing power of God’s love. 

T h e  C a m p a i g n
We now come to where the rubber meets the road.  This is where you come in.  We are looking to partner with people to reach our goal of $20,000 to turn this script into the impactful movie it promises to be.  I know what you are thinking. What will $20,000 allow us to do and is that even enough money to make a movie? Let me begin by saying that we have already put countless hours and thousands of dollars of our own into making this a reality. All of the money that we are seeking will go towards production and marketing for the film. We will be paying for the actors, equipment, sound engineer, make-up artist, and locations.  I will be wearing the producer and director hat for the film. I have experience directing and producing on multiple productions, including a movie that premiered at Camelot Theater in Palm Springs, California. Another way we are able to make a quality film with a low budget is by being selective in theaters. By utilizing a central theater in each geographic location instead showing in every theater in every city we will still have the exposure that we seek while maintaining a low overhead. Along with these processes we have a solid marketing plan and established relationships with associates from many different forms of media, including television and radio. While we are confident that we will meet or exceed our goal, we believe in having a plan B.  Rest assured that whatever amount we raise will be used to create this film and get it to the big screen.  As they say, ‘the show must go on.’ As a bonus to giving to a worthy cause and bringing a dark subject into the light, we have gifts and incentives in appreciation to your generosity, including having your own cameo in the film. 

T h e  I m p a c t
Your contribution is not only going forward to assist in the creation of a movie that is going to open eyes to the reality and oppression of domestic violence and give hope to those who are victims of this terrible affliction, but also to an established organization that has taken over 3 million calls in the 20 years since its inception.  We have partnered up with The National Domestic Violence Hotline to impact the lives of those attempting to get assistance for or flee from dangerous and violent homes.  We have pledged 10% of the total profits of the movie to thehotline.org. Since 1996, the National Domestic Violence Hotline has been a vital link to safety for women, men, children and families affected by domestic violence. With the help of their dedicated advocates and staff, they respond to calls 24/7, 365 days a year. They provide confidential, one-on-one support to each caller and chatter, offering crisis intervention, options for next steps and direct connection to sources for immediate safety. Their database holds over 5,000 agencies and resources in communities all across the country.  They have bilingual staff on hand to answer calls and their Language Line offers translations in over 170 different languages.  Talk about impact.  Along with our commitment of 10% of the total profits, our trailer and movie will feature The National Domestic Violence Hotline’s contact information. 

T h e  W r a p – u p
There are obviously no shortage of individuals looking to get funded for their projects, many of whom are seeking finances for other great causes and burdens. What makes us different from them?  Why should you give to us?  Well, some of you that read this know and love us.  We love you too and thank you for giving. Many of you, however, don’t know us at all.  We understand that. Let me tell you why you should partner with us. This is what we know about you. With such alarming statistics it is a guarantee that many of you reading this right now have deep wounds from firsthand experience with domestic violence.  Another handful of visitors here have cousins, or sisters, maybe even roommates that you believe are being abused in their relationships. Some of you right now are currently living in fear and hopelessness in a home where domestic violence is a daily occurrence. There are so many afflicted and yet the amount of attention domestic violence gets is staggeringly small.  Here’s a chance to make a difference. Help us to help someone before it is too late. Partner with us and The National Domestic Violence Hotline. Join us on our journey to change the world starting right here with this film. There may be some reading this that absolutely don’t have the means to give financially but have read this and feel compelled to intervene in some way.  Please be praying for us and our project. Even more so, pray for those in violent and abusive relationships.

story:
Eleven years ago Carol and I neared completion of the Hungry Mind Café when she was diagnosed and succumbed to Cancer. Carol's Hungry Mind Café was opened and after some years of struggled has become financially sound and, what is more, has become the social hub of Middlebury.
    Next year the railroad bridges outside the door of the café will be replaced and the street will be closed from April till November. Customers will have to walk from distant parking areas and will have to contend with the noise of jack hammering and large equipment. I expect business to drop dramatically.
   That is why I started another shop in New Haven which is the next town North of Middlebury. It is on the main highway and I expected to capture the daily commuters. The shop is in one section of the building and with the profits I was going to renovate the other section to make a diner. The business is growing but not fast enough. In order to offset the losses expected in Middlebury next year I have to get the diner going soon.
      Many customers who visit the New Haven shop are saying that they frequented the diner that was there in years past and look forward to seeing it opened again. They remember it being like Middlebury's Carol's is today, a place where people gathered to see their neighbors and meet new people.
     I have already outfitted much of the kitchen area but the rest of the diner is going to need a lot of work. There are two bathrooms to be retrofitted, a completely refinished floor, electrician and plumbing costs, etc. I expect the basic renovations to cost $20,000. Added to this are hidden costs and the money needed to keep the place going during the initial months. I estimated everything to come to $30,000.
    I hope you will help Carol's make it over the bridge. In doing so you will be preserving a social gathering spot in Middlebury and contributing to a new one in New Haven.
Thank you,
John

story:
I am the mother of three children, the youngest only 8 years old, and a breast cancer survivor. After realizing a 9-5 job with no schedule flexibility was not going to work for me, but not wanting to end my career in writing and marketing, I came up with the idea of starting my own agency. I also decided I would seek out other marketers, writers, designers, and developers who also need flexibility due to a chronic or terminal illness of their own (or of their family member).

Medical expenses have wiped out my savings and maxed out my credit cards, but I've been fortunate enough to remain employed almost continuously since my diagnosis. I am also fortunate to have a great team of people willing to freelance or work on the side to help me get the agency going, some with years of experience in graphic design, content marketing, public relations, blogging, and website creation. And some of those wonderful people are also cancer survivors.

Money from this campaign will go directly toward startup expenses, including:

  • The creation of a website and promotional materials to market the agency
  • Software and hardware to run the business, such as Adobe Creative Cloud
  • A safety net to cover the pay of those working for me in case our first few clients pay late (or not at all)

Your contribution will not only help me, but it will help others who want to remain employed in a field they love, but are challenged by the 9-5 schedule and limited PTO they receive. And, if my agency becomes as successful as I hope it will become, it will ensure I can leave something behind for my children should my prognosis change and the worst happen.

No Guarantee of Success

I realize that wanting to start an agency and hoping it will be successful does not guarantee things will work out as planned. However, I've been working in marketing for more than a decade and have the support of others with as much - or more - experience than I have. Additionally, I've already secured several clients and intend to continue working at my 9-5 job as long as I can so that I need not take a paycheck from the agency and can instead focus on its growth and on paying those who contribute to its success.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help out financially, please share this campaign with others that you know. And, if you or someone you know is suffering from a chronic medical condition that requires schedule flexibility, please reach out to me.

Thank You!

story:
Purpose of Campaign

The purpose of Barkan Research’s campaign is to generate contributions so that our book titled: The Colossal Book of Criminal Citations 2nd Edition 2015 can be provided free of charge to those who are financially disadvantaged. The Colossal Book of Criminal Citations 2nd Edition 2015 is published by Barkan Research and retails for $64.95. The book is also provided at a reduced cost of $54.95 to anyone incarcerated. The individuals who benefit most from this book are imprisoned and often unable to afford a book on their own. All revenue generated through this campaign will be used to supply free copies of our book to indigent inmates who are unable to afford a book for themselves.

Barkan Research receives weekly requests from incarcerated inmates seeking a free copy of this beneficial book. As a small business, Barkan Research does not have the financial ability to give away free books. That is why I need your help.

As the video indicates, as incentive to participate in this campaign, anyone making a contribution of $75.00 or more will receive an honorary copy of The Colossal Book of Criminal Citations 2nd Edition 2015. Please keep in mind you may contribute any amount affordable for you. All proceeds over our goal amount will be used to print and distribute books to indigent inmates. Thank you for your support and please share our campaign with others.

About the book

The Colossal Book of Criminal Citations (2nd Edition) 2015 by Richard Davis 8.5 x 11 [507 pgs.]

The Colossal Book of Criminal Citations 2nd Edition 2015 is an imperative tool for all accused and convicted criminal defendants who are representing themselves or have professional legal assistance. Regardless of your legal or educational background, The Colossal Book of Criminal Citations 2nd Edition 2015 will help an inmate understand and challenge the many aspects of their criminal case. Whether an inmate, legal advocate or jailhouse lawyer requests this book,this book is an essential topical collection of criminal case citations to be the bridge between accusation and justice. This book includes: 3700+ citation references for Supreme, Circuit, District and State courts, sample Federal and State Jury instructions, district court addresses (All 50 States, District of Columbia, Guam, Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands), 100+ topics and 500+ legal definitions.

Please visit our website at www.barkanresearch.com for more information.

story:
My name is Brandie and this year I turned 40:) I have spent my life dedicated to animals and have been thrown into creating a job for myself and my family in a very small town in Northern BC. I have 18 years experience in dog training, 8 years experience in Vet assistance and 2 years as a business owner. I'm a good little saver and can squirrel money away like my grandparents and I work solid 15 hour days, 7 days a week.

This campaign is created out of necessity. The financial struggles faced by my job are insurmountable. The banks are bound to very strict rules and according to them I do not have a job and therefore do not qualify for funding. As a 40 year old white female living in the north and working with animals I can not find a single grant I qualify for.

I need to be able to hire competent help and set up a work environment that is self sustaining and requires less maintenance.

This funding would go directly into wages for carpenters to repair current kennels, winterize buildings for efficient energy use and help create proper fencing. This funding will also go into wages for a part time hardworking individual to help with daily chores, maintenance and entertaining our four legged guests.

Bakers Acres Kennels is unique because we are not a typical "storage unit" kennel. We offer pups a vacation, I know, I know...all kennels say that, but we truly are. Dogs get the run of the property and help me in the garden or keep my feet warm while I'm grooming. I work hard to bond with each pup, that bond is what makes me unique. Humans tend to create animals that cannot live without us, then we stick them in a kennel where they release anxious energy any way they can and destroy the kennel while creating noise levels that have neighbors signing petitions. Once a pup is bonded to me they can happily follow me, feeling safe and loved. I also believe strongly in being honest, even to owners who hide behind their rose colored glasses. (I love mine! They are large rosé pink frames with several diamonds in each corner and multicolored roses painted along the arms...Elton would be proud:))  Another unique thing about Bakers Acres is that we are passionate and dedicated to stray animals. We work closely with local animal shelters, foster and rehome strays and volunteer extensively to provide free services for low income owners. We believe that although owning an animal is a privilege and not a right, it is sometimes essential for our well being.       

I currently employ an elderly low income lady who does the kennel laundry for $40/week plus free services. She works hard, she is dependable and extremely appreciated but she deserves more. I also employ a young teenager from a troubled family who works hard and deserves more than I give her. We strive to be her role models so she can rise above her situation and we love her as a member of the family. My talented brother is our carpenter on call during his weekends. He has stepped into my fathers shoes and has created a working kennel and grooming room from an old garage. My unpaid gardener, kennel manager, accountant, secretary, house cleaner, babysitter and gopher deserves more than just the bragging rights of being the mother of the local "dog whisperer". ("Ohhh....what I wouldn't give to meet Cesar Millan!" says the little girl in my head with pigtails and white knee high socks, dreaming the impossible dream!)

One thing about me is that I am passionate. I have so many ideas that frustrate me because I simply have no means to fund them: 

            I would  love to create a doggie park on the property where owners can come exercise their dogs. The parks in town are not "off leash" dog friendly, or dog friendly at all. I would love that park to be connected to a fully fenced walking trail geared towards seniors.  Contractors in the area have quoted me over $60,000 for basic fencing. We have many walking trails in this lush forest area but they are not senior friendly with long walks, no resting benches and steep hills.

            During cold winter months I use the hallway in the kennel as our "exercise room"...I quietly plot ways to build a heated indoor arena where boarders and community dogs can play and get much needed exercise and socialization in cold temperatures. (I say this as I rub my hands together with an knowing smile and one eyebrow raised in mischief!)

            My current 4 room dog kennel and 6 room cat kennel are not sufficent to house more than 1-2 stray dogs or cats. A separate building designed for strays would allow Bakers Acres to fully utilize kennel space for business.

            I would also LOVE to extend my monopoly by purchasing an engraving machine that can provide pet tags. Owners currently have to order on line or travel 3 hours to the nearest city to obtain personalized collar tags. Owners get upset when these tags get lost as this is sometimes their pets only voice to be returned to them in an emergency. I'd love to expand this service into tags for horse halters. We live in a large horse community that comes together regularly in support of multiple causes and camaraderie in which many halters get mixed up and lost. Besides....bling is fun!! Encouraging young people to get off their electronic devices and out with the animals teaches life skills and sometimes you just need a little bling to get them excited.

            This is the point in my spiel where I sit back in my chair, drop my hands to my side, raise my head to the sky, close my eyes and sigh....I would love to have an office. A quiet, warm office with a desk, filing cabinet, and a doggie bed at my feet for my Henry. My current "office" is a desk in the living room of our 2 bedroom trailer (but that's another story!). I'd build my office to double as a reception area for clients before entering the noisy kennel. Discussions about pets usually take place in the driveway so we don't have to yell over each other and hope the information is clear and understood.

You can help...Your time is just as important as money. Research to find a used engraving machine that someone might be willing to donate....find a contractor that is willing to travel to a small northern community in exchange for advertising his business. Find grants that mature white females in animal related small business qualify for. Anyone out there work on business plans? (My current business plan is inspiring but not up to date) Yell about this campaign and challange others to match your "yell" or donation. Have a skill....knit a blanket for a stray cat, make a dog toy for a pup that is waiting for a new home. Send ideas and inspiration for reusing/recycling materials to create dog/cat houses, increase energy efficiency, fundraisers to help strays and low income families..... If you know the person who chooses the lottery numbers , I would sure love some insider information (hint, hint).

Owners get upset when these tags get lost as this is sometimes their pets only voice to be returned to them in an emergency. I'd love to expand this service into tags for horse halters. We live in a large horse community that comes together regularly in support of multiple causes and camaraderie in which many halters get mixed up and lost. Besides....bling is fun!! Encouraging young people to get off their electronic devices and out with the animals teaches life skills and sometimes you just need a little bling to get them excited.            This is the point in my spiel where I sit back in my chair, drop my hands to my side, raise my head to the sky, close my eyes and sigh....I would love to have an office. A quiet, warm office with a desk, filing cabinet, and a doggie bed at my feet for my Henry. My current "office" is a desk in the living room of our 2 bedroom trailer (but that's another story!). I'd build my office to double as a reception area for clients before entering the noisy kennel. Discussions about pets usually take place in the driveway so we don't have to yell over each other and hope the information is clear and understood.You can help...Your time is just as important as money. Research to find a used engraving machine that someone might be willing to donate....find a contractor that is willing to travel to a small northern community in exchange for advertising his business. Find grants that mature white females in animal related small business qualify for. Anyone out there work on business plans? (My current business plan is inspiring but not up to date) Yell about this campaign and challange others to match your "yell" or donation. Have a skill....knit a blanket for a stray cat, make a dog toy for a pup that is waiting for a new home. Send ideas and inspiration for reusing/recycling materials to create dog/cat houses, increase energy efficiency, fundraisers to help strays and low income families..... If you know the person who chooses the lottery numbers , I would sure love some insider information (hint, hint).

story:
We need your Help

“Together We Can Grow” designs, builds Aquaponic systems that are used in developing countries. 

Our Aquaponic systems are low cost, high production yield, very simplistic to run and maintain. 

We have designed them for large scale farming and are aimed at providing sustainable living in areas where there is poverty and have been running Aquaponic Farms in Thailand for over 3 years. 

OUR SOLE AIM IS TO: provide Aquaponic Farms to Organisations or Individuals that are carrying out humanitarian projects. This then empowers these Organisations or Individuals to change people’s lives for the long term through sustainable and self-funding farming methods.

If you become apart of the "Owners Group" please email us, so we can send you reports on the Project  www.togetherwecangrow.com

The Project Below is where we will use the next system

Information provided by Keo Bonarithy 

Project: Neal Village

Location: Neal village is the one of 10 villages of Tang Duong Community, Bati district, Takeo province. Actually we work with the whole community.

Location 11.325462, 104.728234

Partners: Partners for Community Development

and Together We Can Grow

Owners Group: TBA

Co-Operative: TBA

About Partner and Project:

The Neal village is locate at the middle of these communities where it has the authority office there like the community office, police administration office, school, market…etc.

This project will be an amazing start to helping our vison of to see community out from poverty to dignity by development in economic, social and faith and through the partnership

This project will affect more than 20 family groups and help the community to stop working in sweat shop factories where they earn about $100 us per month


Our vision is to see the community move from poverty to dignity by developing in economic, social and moral skills by working with our partners.

Currently we have three projects operating at Neal village, Tangdoung commune, Bati district, Takeo province.

Education Life.

Education is the way that we can change people’s thinking. Without education the future is unclear and hopeless. Partners for Community development provides a place for study for around 100 children in two centers located in their village. In order to create a good environment for the children, we teach them English Language, Khmer, Mathematic, and creative life skills.

 Our dream: we want to see children have a safe place to come and learn the good skills that they can apply to everyday life.

Households Agriculture Development

Teaching the people to catch the fish is better than giving fish to the people. Our dream is to see the people using the resources around them to create better opportunities for their life. 85% of the Cambodia population is at the country side and rely on agriculture. By training, showing and following up with them, our project will make sure that the people who work with us in the Pig, Chicken and Vegetable growing activities become secure and make an income for their family.

The challenge for us is:

1-The cost of the input in every area of production is high and the competition in the market makes it difficult for us to generate enough profit to cover all our costs.

2- We need more time and resources to teach people the necessary skills to either run their business or apply for external employment.

story:
100 Microfarms in 5 Years

Starting in summer of 2015, LAND ACTION is partnering with urban farmers to initiate 100 urban farms in Oakland over the next 5 years.

These microfarms will include tiny home farmhouses, creating affordable housing for urban farmers and organizers.

The farms will also serve as demonstration gardens and community farms, helping spread knowledge on food sustainability along with growing hundreds of tons of vegetables to be distributed locally.

We are selecting properties based on their long term viability to stay farms indefinitely.  To ensure that vision we are working with land trusts, gardeners, farmers, non-profits dedicated to urban agriculture, and other allies in the environmental and social justice movements to create long-term community-based ownership models to ensure that these farms stay farms for generations to come.

We do not consider our work “charity,” and are opposed to the hierarchy embedded in all “charitable” models.  We operate rather on a model of solidarity, by empowering autonomous farmers and land cultivation groups through the networking of resources and the proliferation of mutual aid.

We want our farming partners to achieve autonomy, so we are working on a decentralized skillshare model, so that they can work together and teach each other, as we all learn to navigate the existing power structures, that we may gain empowerment and practical skills in challenging and changing those structures.

Please help keep these efforts going! 

Our Goals For this Initial Campaign

We have created a model that is low-cost, with an estimated cost of $3750 for the set up of each microfarm.

Our goal of $35,000 in this first round of fundraising is to have resources to both pay for the setup costs for a small number of farms as well as the seed money to begin administration of the program.

Community and Environmental Benefits

By merging the urban agriculture movement with the tiny home movement we can allow farmers to continue to develop their skills as urban farmers, rather than being pushed from the city due to housing costs.
This project is an anti-gentrification tactic, as we are actively pulling properties out of the speculative market, which is at the root of capital-based displacement.

Land Action Has the Experience and Skills

Even when urban agriculture projects have sufficient resources to be environmentally sustainable such projects often face legal and political challenges. Gardens and farms in urban areas often end in eviction either due to issues involving property ownership or legal or political roadblocks.

Land Action has a track record of overcoming these issues in the past by establishing and defending land occupations. Also, Land Action has built alliances with land trusts as well as city and county governments. By creating both the legal and political framework before placing microfarms on these sites Land Action is uniquely positioned to solve these problems.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donate what you can today, but please don't stop there:
  • Come to our garden events and help build enthusiasm at our initial pilot projects
  • Please share this campaign with everyone you know who cares about the environment, food justice, social justice, housing rights, and sustainable community development.
  • Start developing your own urban microfarming proposal so that after this campaign is successful you can steward your own site
  • Please share this campaign with gardeners, landscapers, and urban agriculture organizers to help build our grassroots base and help with our subsequent outreach efforts.

Also you can join our email list to learn about upcoming work parties, garden launches, and more!

To join:
1) go to https://lists.riseup.net/www/info/landaction 
2) Click the green "subscribe button"

story:
Brief summary

In India nowadays, reality is that 32,7% of its citizens are considered, according to international standards, not as poor, but as extreme poor. Famine, insufficient health conditions and illiteracy seem to be a natural condition, being especially present in the rural areas of India. In this male dominated society, women struggle with cultural limitations and discrimination making them the disadvantaged out of the disadvantaged. Unable to ignore their struggle, we decided to act and started the Saath Mahila Credits and Savings Cooperative Society Ltd.. Working as a branch of Saath Charitable Trust, a 25 year old organisation, the Cooperative Society tackles women´s need for financial independence.

In Hindi “saath” means together, which is the best way to describe how we work and what we aim. Our efforts are invested in a cooperative manner in creating inclusive societies through the empowering of the individuals forming it. Our NGO is involved in a wide variety of programs targeting the disadvantaged in the Indian society ranging from providing informal education, to children living on construction sites, to providing financial independence. The latter is the core of this campaign. Saath Mahila Savings and Credit Cooperative Society Ltd. offers, after only four years, financial services to over 4400 women in rural areas of Ahmedabad district enabling them to expand and improve their options to livelihood. We promote, a previously non-existing, saving habit and grant the women access to micro loans aimed at different financial necessities including business opening investments and unexpected health problems. This campaign intends to expand our services through opening our third branch in the village of Mandal.

What we need

We promote self-sustainable and long lasting projects, which do not rely on donations and funders. Our Micro financial services ensure self-sustainability through interests on the various financial products. Nonetheless, these require an initial one-time investment: Reserves to ensure the initial emissions of loans. Our expansion to the village of Mandal will require at least $60,000 for this purpose. We aim at fundraising the bare minimum we need.

We kindly invite you to contribute as much as you can and remind you that every contribution, as small it might be, counts! Further we would like to use the occasion to thank you in advance for your interest and help.

In Saath we are aware of the common mistrust towards NGOs and invite you to visit our website www.saath.org where you will find our annual reports including our financial statements. Transparency is a must. 

The impact of your help

The impact of your contributions will be far-reaching, as the opening of a new brand will grant financial independence to over 1000 women for a lifetime. Financial inclusion is a vital tool in the fight against poverty. Access to financial service enables these women to become micro entrepreneurs and to insure themselves against complications as drought or sickness. Further, this has a direct impact on their children, who often face child labor given the fact that families cannot afford school expenses. A small effort on your side can empower women and their children to the necessary means to overcome poverty, discrimination and illiteracy, as plain and simple as that.

Risks and challenges

The risks of our expansion are nearly non-existent given the fact that over 100 women have already shown interest for our services in the city of Mandal and the branches in Viramgam and Dholka have been successfully operating for over four years. The main challenge we face is the provision of reserves for our expansions, as the demand for financial services in rural India is high and nearly unsupplied.

Other forms of contributing

If currently you cannot contribute to our cause financially you can always help us spreading the word and sharing our campaign with family, friends and people who might be interested in it.

Once again thank you. We could not make it without you!

story:
The Community Project:

I am Satyama Lasby. I am passionate about communities and have lived in different communities since 2009, when I left my career in Canada to live a life with deeper meaning. Instead of life being one big quest to be successful for myself, I sought one where we were more connected as humans, living through the support of each others's talents, skills, productions and produce.


It is time to go deeper into my passion and document and share on a wider scale how people live in intentional (or non-intentional) communities. Some work better than others and mature with time and the leadership within them. Some communities are thriving. Some rely on rules and models. Some have meditation as the base; some agriculture; some simply exist, constantly changing due to the constant movement of travellers...(ie: the one I have been living in for the past two years.)


I am headed to Tamera, an international and intentional community in Portugal for a month long study of this community and the experiences of others called "The Community Course." I am campaigning for the funding of this course so that I may have the means to participate and share the recommendations of principles and agreements that this community seems to work from.


What am I going to do?

By funding this campaign, you as a contributor will help me achieve a freedom in which to fulfill a life of purpose - that which can be shared with the practical application of a study and recommendations for future and existing communities across the world. This study is meant to be delivered to publications about communities and also in person, by me as a facilitator, to developing communities and those going through transitional times, or those needing progressive change via the change in roles, hierarchical structure, openness, or models of successful, communication.


I am desiring funding to take the course, which is 750 Euros, accommodation and food for the time I am there - 45 USD/day, as well as a flight from Thailand - 1200 USD (where I currently actively participate in the community on the west side of Koh Phagnan,) where many spiritual seekers, yogis, vegetarians and healers attempt to find their life purpose, answers, healing and greater awareness on the big picture of the universe and our current role in it. This community has a reputation for bring one that supports openness in relationships, yet the community remains to be one with secrets on the relating end of the spectrum. I am hoping to learn from the model of Tamera in how they deal with open relating, sharing partners, and communicating on the emotions that often arise when sex, jealousy or comparison feelings arise. I am looking to see what is making this community be a thriving one.

Perks

$500 - gives you an original painting on canvas or paper done by me - I will ship it to you!
$65 - gives you a pack of custom-designed postcards, based on creative, spiritual paintings I have produced in Thailand.
$30 - Pack of damiana, which is an herb that you can make tea out of to relax, or to boost your libido...the yogis like it to smoke or for tea, and I would like you to feel its subtle effects if you are interested.
$5 - a Heartfelt thank-you, a meditation dedicated to your health and well-being, consecrated to the divine consciousness.

  • If I do not reach the entire goal of  my campaign, the funds that I do raise will go to Tamera - they are organizing the course and it costs 30 Euro/day for food alone.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • This project is valuable you the contributor and to the world, because there is a global movement of people who wish to live in community, as tribes once did. We are evolving to a place of knowing that isolation via our own large houses, cars, and small families keep us separate from the community. People who want to live in communities and learn from each other will benefit from contribution because I am making a focused study on Tamera's models and will be experimenting with the model shown there, as well as bringing my own leadership experience to the community of Tamera . Contributing will help all beings to see how living in community can make an impactful difference in everyone's quality of life.
  • In terms of my experience with a project, I am a well-known facilitator and trainer on Koh Phagnan, respected by the community. I am a yoga therapist, Gestault facilitator, massage and art therapist, so when emotions arise, I am equipped to handle the storm, and assist others in managing emotions raised by conflicting beliefs or experiences.
  • If you have suggestions on what to share with Tamera in this month-long journey, I am happy to hear them, documents them and discuss  how different people run different lives.

Risks & Challenges...hmmm.

I may run out of the money I have for this project. 

The internet doesn't work well in this community so documenting processes and models being taught, as well as promoting what I am doing with the teachings might be difficult when there.

I don't know anyone at Tamera, so much of my time will be spent going through the "hoops" of being new in a community.

I will be documenting the important teachings/learnings even without an internet connection during the course, and then work on the promotional element when I have a better connection after the course is completed.

My aim is not to "know" everyone in the Tamera community, but rather, to make strong, lasting relationships with those who will be doing something in communities based on the findings of the course.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Would you kindly get the word out and make some noise about my Community Project campaign?
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

That's all there is to this project. Be in touch as the world progresses.

story:
Who am I and why is this important?

Hey everyone!  Thank you for taking the time to check out my campaign to help me Do Cool Sh*t!!!  My name is Jamie Barnes, and I am a driven and passionate aspiring entrepreneur.  With your help I would like to transform my passion and nerdiness for personal development into a community of people who live life consciously to the fullest and who are truly HAPPY.  Like, actually happy. Not what the world tells you about happiness.  By contributing to my campaign, you  will be helping ingrain the success mindset into the new generation of game changers.

Why am I asking for money?

A great man once said "Started from the bottom, now I will... be there soon." -- that's a popular culture reference for all my wise friends and family out there. ;)

Here's the breakdown of what I'm asking for:

  • $2,000: tuition
  • $500: flight
  • $500: hotel for 5 nights
  • $500: food and bootcamp bonding
If I raise more money than my goal I will use the cash for business purposes including website hosting/building, business networking cards, and books to give as gifts to my donors!

The plan

Without spilling all the beans, here's what you can expect to see from me after I attend the Do Cool Sh*t Bootcamp:

  • A class/seminar geared towards graduating college students on how to adapt a success mindset in the real world and live life to the absolute fullest
  • A website/blog and online community focusing on helping its members stay accountable to theirs goals
  • Video book reviews outlining key points and reasons why you should read them

 Why does the world need this?

  • We live in a time where humans have the greatest opportunity to create success, health, and happiness for themselves yet so few actually do.
  • This is a huge problem! So much human potential is being wasted through people living life not on purpose and just going through the motions.
  • It's time to change that, Why Not Us will help people establish absolute clarity in regards to what kind of life they want to create for themselves and their families.

What I hope to gain from attending Do Cool Sh*T

  • Networking opportunities with like minded people and top entrepreneurs
  • Learn how to implement what I've learned through reading and create an actual business that is both profitable and helpful
  • Gain experience pitching my business to top investors who are looking to fund new projects

story:
tl;dr

Reno Pub and Games (RPG) is a business started by two lifelong gamers, Bill and Joe. We are both passionate about the gaming community and have experience in retail and food service. We've also observed that gamers truly lack a dedicated commercial "third space" (not home, not work, where you go to get away from both!) that catered to them the way they need. RPG seeks to fill that hole. We are not a "barcade" in the classical sense because you will be able to play the video games you love to play at home and with your friends and we aren't a "pay by the hour" business either! We want to give you the space you need to be yourselves, together, while providing a serious assortment of beers, sodas, energy drinks, and food options that we will develop as we grow! We anticipate becoming a community hotspot for your weekly tabletop roleplaying game sessions, trading card game faceoffs, or what ever game you gather with friends around! RPG will host tournaments as well as allow the community to have a place to host them with as little headache as possible.

We love games and we love gamers (not to mention we love beer, too) and we will make RPG the best place to be a gamer in all of Reno! With enough success we would love to duplicate the success we have here in other areas as well and someday have a brand everybody will recognize!

Phat Lewts

For us, the money we raise here will give us a bedrock on which we will build our success. Starting a business isn't cheap and we've put a lot of ourselves into this and we are committed to the end! Your contribution will help us open our doors and keep them open during the hardest phase of opening a business: the beginning! Gamers understand that how you play the first few levels of a game will have a huge impact on the rest of the game. Help us make our first level go smoothly!
Now, the real reason you read this section, the awesome loot we have planned for our backers! In short summary, our perks include some material aweseomeness as well as a permanent and exclusive "achievement" you can show off to patrons of RPG for epic bragging rights. Our achievements come with pins with exclusive designs to show others what you've accomplished and our backers will receive the "Beta Tester" achievement and pin that will never be offered again! It will come in multiple levels so that if you really want to show off, you can. On top of that, qualifying levels will come with T-Shirts with our emblem and the Beta Tester title, to further be able to rub it in your friends' faces that you were here first! We will be selling RPG shirts but the only way to get the Beta Tester edition is to back us here. There are other miscellaneous material goodies you can check out in the Perks area. Finally, for our most dedicated backers, we want to give you a time you won't ever forget at RPG! Our highest tiers all include getting a piece (or ALL!) of RPG for you and a select group of your friends to enjoy, uninterrupted, with food and drink on the house! We love RPG and we love our backers, so know that supporting us here, on any level, earns you some serious appreciation that we will always be sure to extend to you, regardless of what "official" perks you get.

Want a Side Quest?

Not sure you can contribute or want to help us beyond giving money? Please tell your friends about us! Share this campaign, our website (www.renopubandgames.com), and our Facebook (www.facebook.com/renopubandgames) with all your friends and everyone you know. We appreciate your support, what ever form it may come!

story:
What We Stand For

H = helping, O = opportunities (for) P = personal (and) E= employment (issues)

HOPE Stream is a social purpose business whose goal is to create Healthy Communities in two ways:  
1) Creating the healthiest drinking bottle out there
2) Connecting people with poverty and mental health issues to employment opportunities and the best healthcare options available. 
How are We doing this?
1) Healthiest Bottles : These bottles have been researched extensively. When tested, the Total Dissolved Solids test for these bottles remained at '0'. All other bottles - including other glass bottles - had some leaching. These bottles are revolutionary!
In addition, HEALTHY BOTTLES = HEALTHY COMMUNITIES. They are an environmental choice. For each bottle bought, countless bottles are saved from being produced from fossil fuels and going into the landfill and oceans.
2) Providing healthcare and counselling opportunities to people with poverty and mental health issues :  50% of the profits of these bottles goes towards this goal. Poverty and mental health issues often go hand-in-hand; when people have trouble functioning and making a living they often don't reach out and can suffer tragic consequences including illness and at worst violation of others and/or suicide. Gaining access to sufficient healthcare and counselling opportunities is essential to ameliorating these situations and eradicating the issues. With this they can become functioning participants in their community/society who may also be able to hold down employment - creating  stability for themselves in and with their community.
This is what the creation of these bottles is truly dedicated to.

Who I am and my Vision

My name is Marsaye and I have been counselling (Cdn spelling) people with mental health issues for the past 32 years. I have a Masters degree and have worked entirely on the front lines. Being only one person with a lot of vision, I am calling on the community far and wide to help grow the HOPE.
The magnitude of this goal is immeasurable. Imagine living in a world where people who are behaving strangely are cared for and helped, rather than ignored, feared and pushed away. What impact does that behaviour have on them? If this is turned around....Imagine how they then will carry this 'help' forward and contribute! This is the Vision of HOPE Stream.


What We Need & What You Get

  •  $10,000 will produce more bottles, professionalize the brochure with an artist and with shiny, better quality paper, hire people to do sales and demo's, and perhaps some advertising.
  • If we do not reach our entire goal the funds will go towards 1) producing more bottles, 2) brochures printed on better-quality paper, and 3) hiring people to do demos and sales. All of these will still help us grow HOPE significantly.
  • In return for your generous contributions, I am offering perks ranging from: personalized thank you's, your own personal HOPE Water Bottle, a free counselling session, coming to speak at your event about HOPE, and/or offering cross-promotion for our top sponsors.  Have a look at the perks list on the side and choose your favourite!

The Impact

The impact is multi-layered and results in the creation of healthy communities with: less crime, less conflict and people helping each other through the difficult times. It starts at home ~ in our communities with the people we know. It is a wonderful feeling to experience the satisfaction of doing what you can to help.


Risks & Challenges

  As this grows I intend to let go of some of my front line work ( as an independent service provider) and hire people in my place. My role will then be to help the front line people to debrief and keep their energy focused. 

In this process, I can dedicate more time to the creation of more health care provider - client links, as well as to bottle sales.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word - get the word out about this campaign ~ remember to use the Indiegogo share tools. Volunteer artist or printing services!
