story:
Do you know USE-IT? The amazing, colorful printed maps and mobile applications that can be found in 43 European cities and that make traveling a completely different experience by introducing the city from the perspective of locals, young people and those who know the best spots and hottest up-to-date tips and stories? 
And have you heard about Tbilisi? This capital of Georgia which is full of amazing culture and rich history, endless hospitality, delicious cuisine and specific traditions? The city that is constantly buzzing with life, traffic and a sort of chaos that you just fall in love with?

The match of those two USE-IT and Tbilisi  is exactly what we are aiming to create: The map that will help the visitors to cut the tourists’ blindfold, feel and act like locals, understand the local customs and discover the most interesting no non-sense places to see, shop, eat and drink, get inspired and relaxed. No commercials, just authentic tips from the locals.

Who are we?

We are a Georgian non-governmental organization called Youth Association DRONI. We work with and for young people, mainly those with fewer opportunities (refugees, young people from marginalized areas and communities), help them to learn new skills, develop and get experiences that they cannot learn in educational institutions.

At the moment we are hosting group of 10 international volunteers who work together with local youngsters on exploring the city and culture, while creating an original design for the map and making the best USE-IT map ever! The volunteers are collecting all the information and, apart from the map itself, sharing all their adventures in a blog. The information in the printed map and application will be completed with a website which is going to have even more tips and tricks!

The organization has a lot of experience with implementing local and international projects, such as Street Music Day, Udabno Festival, Human Library, No Hate Speech Movement etc. But this is the first time we work on a map! We are doing our best to succeed and to overcome all the obstacles that we might face.


Our project: USE-IT Tbilisi

We decided that for the biggest impact of our map and promotion of the city, we must become a member of international USE-IT.travel family. We basically love the concept of free, noncommercial, no non-sense maps targeting mainly young travelers and backpackers, but also anyone who has a bit adventurous soul and wants to move around the city by public transportation, understand the rules of traditional Georgian supra and know the inside stories and urban legends.

We have been working on achieving this goal for more than half a year now. Considering all the costs, it is not an easy task. We had a promise for the funding from Tbilisi City Hall, but because of the recent floods and damage caused by the them, they could not support us. That is why we need to find other ways of funding to achieve all our objectives.


What do we need the money for?

At this moment we are fundraising money to pay for the USE-IT membership fee, which is 1000 EUR per year. We are also fundraising a some amount for promotional materials, stationary, printing and moving around that we need to cover during the process of working on the map. 

Our main rewards for you are the freshly printed, still warm copies of the maps, hand-made decorated T-shirts, postcards, stickers. However, the best reward will be if you visit the city and you can experience it with our map in your hands, discovering all the amazing places we have selected for you!


You cannot contribute, but still want to help?

We will appreciate all the tips for the cool places in Tbilisi to visit and check. If they are awesome, we might include them in the map. You can also prepare a little thematic tour for us, if you know some aspect of Tbilisi very well.

Please fill in our little survey, helping us to find the cool places that locals like to visit! You can also like our Facebook, follow our Twitter and our blog and help us to spread the word.

story:
Who is Hotti Biscotti?

Hotti Biscotti is passion. It is caring. It is community.

Six years ago, Debby Stroud found the courage to walk away from her career and follow her dream of running a bakery.  From a small catering business, we have grown into an entity capable of serving huge weddings, conferences, and pleasing a steady stream of walk-in customers with our unique take on classic Italian dessert. Since day one, Hotti Biscotti has been running on passion, lots of sugary sweetness, and a little bit of faith in the support of the Hamilton community.

Two years later, a little bit of faith went a long way, and after four great years Hotti’s heart is growing beyond the walls of our tiny shop in Westdale Village. The locally owned and operated bakery is ready to take another leap –into the centre of the booming James North food scene. Our softer texture biscotti, peanut butter pops, chocolate toffee pretzels, snowball cookies, and ice cream sandwiches are just the tip of the iceberg – we’re capable of stocking a larger storefront with brownies, cookies, vegan options and even more brand new tantalizing treats that we know you’ll be crazy about!

We’re asking Hamilton to help us make the downtown core a little bit sweeter.

What Hotti Needs

Expansion is AWESOME, but growth is costly. Our flexible ask of $10,000 should help put our worries to rest and focus on the many amazing things about our relocation.

Here are a few of the expenses piling up on our to-do list…

  • City permits, architectural costs, zoning & verification
  • Renovations & design
  • Expanding our staff
  • New, more sustainable packaging (yay!)

Why give? To help us give more.

This campaign isn’t all about financial backing. The concept of crowd-funding finds it’s roots in inspiring and involving the community to get behind a project they care about. We want to foster a following that helps us reach our goals not just for the big move, but to help us benefit the community in the long term. Giving to Hotti is giving to Hamilton.

Hamilton needs love. From staff to clients, we recognize value of truly connecting to those around you. Whether it’s a neighbour, a friend, or someone you make eye contact with on the HSR, a little bit of sweetness goes a long way! A larger, more visible location helps us meet and connect with even more amazing Hamiltonians every day.

Hamilton needs jobs. Not only have we turned hundreds of biscotti critics into believers with our signature softer treats, Debby has spent long hours teaching her close knit team how to craft a perfect chocolate covered pretzel and tie the prettiest ribbon. Our fun, inclusive, and innovative workplace atmosphere serves as the perfect entry-level into the booming Hamilton food industry.

Hamilton needs helping hands. An avid supporter of animal rights, local charity initiatives, and simply supporting her fellow local dreamers, Debby has given endlessly to local charities and organizations close to her heart.

In just 4 years, we have been capable of touching thousands of lives from the walls of a shoebox bakery. In the heart of Hamilton with room for more than two bakers on duty, what we can give is only going to grow.

By being a part of this campaign, you’re not just funding the expansion of another locally owned shop. By funding this campaign, you are saying yes to a community that never stops innovating, inspiring, and bringing people together. So whether it’s a small cash donation, a generous contribution, or simply spreading the word and sharing our message with the rest of the world, we’re asking you to have a little faith – and give, so we can give more to the Hamilton community.

(And a year supply of biscotti never hurt anybody).


Note: Shipping costs will be deducted from the gift cards of out-of-town donors. 
To our valued patrons: We will be relocating to James North once the campaign closes, even if we do not reach our full ask! We can't wait to make new friends in a new community!

story:
Nigeria has over 775 Local Government Areas (Local Councils) with an estimated 100,000 Primary Healthcare Centers located mostly in rural areas, which are aimed at serving the needs of the poor and underserved population.

Sadly, like most secondary and tertiary health institutions in the country, none of these PHCs have functional telephone or telephone numbers or communication systems for emergencies; communication between doctors, nurses and community health-workers; or for simply communicating with the patients/service users in the community. Why do mothers, especially nursing mothers have to walk long hours through difficult terrain just to pick of results of laboratory tests or simply to make health-related inquiries?

Women still die every day from childbirth, new born babies don't survive or die before their first birthdays, children under 5 years of age die of malaria, pneumonia and diarrhea in large numbers surprisingly because sometimes the nurses are unable to telephone (call) the doctors to be in attendance or for life-saving instructions, or the ambulance driver for timely referral etc. There is no doubt that timely communication will help to save many of these lives. This is one of the numerous problems we have decided to address as a non-profit organization.

Adoghe’s Online Public Health Charity Foundation is a registered non-profit charity founded by Dr. Anthony Adoghe, a public health physician who has passion for innovative and cost-effective ways for health promotion. Together with a group of tireless volunteers, we have given free health information and consultations online; using social media; with very good followership on our Facebook page and Facebook group (search “AOPHC”), and offline in rural settlements.

Upon identifying this mind bugling gap of very poor or non-existent means of communication in our health centers, AOPHC has quickly mapped out a project framework that will help to wire and network relevant PHCs in the country and subsequently across Africa and other developing countries, using simple cordless phones.

1. One desktop phone cost $20 - $30 (our initial goal is to get about 10,000 health centers connected).

2. The benefits are enormous; two-way communication between health workers and patients/clients via telephony, SMS (text-messaging) for referrals, reminders for immunizations, emergency contact, etc

3. Subsequent costs and maintenance of the phones is already being negotiated with telecommunications companies and government agencies.

4. It is our goal to have all PHCs, secondary and eventually tertiary healthcare facilities connected for ease of access for both patients/clients and health workers in the very near future

This project will obviously serve as an entry point for other health initiatives.

Our challenges may be much; funding, difficulty in reaching rural facilities due to difficult terrains, government bureaucracy, etc. But we are optimistic and enthusiatic. We work with volunteers and already established local authorities, which helps to minimize administrative costs and ensure that most of the money raised goes towards our course.

Our immediate needs;

1. Funds

2. Vehicles for easy transportation and navigation of difficult road networks

3. Of course MORE volunteers

PLEASE DONATE TO HELP US PUT TELEPHONES AND PERHAPS INTERNET TO SERVE THE HEALTH NEEDS OF THE POOR AND NEEDY, AND ALSO HELP TO SPREAD THE WORD USING INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS. THANK YOU!

story:
Who We Are:

We’re a couple of designers that have decided that we no longer want to waste our time working for other people. We’ve worked long and hard to figure out what it takes to make it on our own and now it’s time for us to find a permanent home. We are Micro.

What is Micro:

Micro is a combination of a retail storefront, design studio, and full print shop all in one. The retail storefront will focus on bringing together the absolute best locally produced products all in one convenient location. Small batch and hard to find products will be featured throughout the store to give it a locally owned boutique feel.

The design studio is where we will offer our expertise in design and creative marketing to any brand or business that is ready to take their product or service to the next level. No matter what stage of the creative process they may be in we can give them the tools and guidance to help them reach their goals.

Our production will also take place under the same roof. We pride ourselves on small batch, premium quality products that we personally take part in producing. This also allows us to really offer a complete design/marketing/production solution to any of our potential clients. We can literally create a graphic in the design studio, print the garment in our print shop, and prep the garment to be sold in our retail shop. A true all in one experience for anyone who has ever dreamt of creating their own brand.

Where is Micro

Micro will be located in downtown Wallingford, CT. This location is ideal for us because we will be in area with heavy foot traffic which will draw shoppers in to our retail store. This in conjunction with a modern and minimalistic interior layout will attract the youthful Wallingford residents. Downtown Wallingford has seen some great changes in the past few years and Micro will be a great addition to complement the rest of new businesses in downtown.

How we are using the money

Starting a business expensive and we need your help with paying for all the start up costs that come along with opening up shop. Paying deposits, setting up utilities and paying rent add up quick and we could use any help we can get.


Perks

T-shirt Choices:



Function Sock Choices:

Additional Designs at FunctionSocks.com


With your help we can make our dream jobs a reality!

story:
"The Future of Railroads: Safety, Workers, Community & the Environment" is a cutting edge conference designed for railroad workers, environmental activists, trackside residents and the community at large, all of whom are concerned about the future of rail. This conference will explore safety and environmental concerns and serve to educate concerned citizens and railroad workers alike about our mutual concerns. Ultimately, the goal of the conference is to construct the beginnings of a "labor - community" alliance that can push for a safer and greener rail industry in North America, one that is more responsive to the needs, concerns, and safety of their employees and the American public. Conference #1 will be held in Richmond, CA on 3/14/15 and be replicated the following weekend with Conference #2 on 3/21/15 in Olympia, WA. NOTE: Any and all funds raised above and beyond the needs of these two conferences will be used as seed money for additional conferences of this nature, planned across the U.S. and Canada in the future.

The conference is sponsored jointly by Railroad Workers United and the Backbone Campaign. The conference has the endorsement of the following organizations:

A. Phillip Randolph Institute - Seattle Chapter

Aboriginal Alliance of Northern Alberta

Asian Pacific Environmental Network

Center for Biological Diversity

Climate Solutions

Communities for a Better Environment — Richmond, CA Chapter

Evergreen Islands

Forest Ethics

Friends of Grays Harbor

Greenpeace USA

Industrial Workers of the World – Bay Area; Bellingham; and Kentucky  GMBs

 International Association of Sheet Metal, Air, Rail, Transportation Workers

       Transportation Division (SMART-TD) Local #31 - Watsonville, CA 

 International Association of Sheet Metal, Air, Rail, Transportation Workers

       Transportation Division (SMART-TD) Local #239 - Oakland, CA

International Longshore & Warehouse Union –  Puget Sound District Council

International Longshore  & Warehouse Union -- Local #4 

Keepers of the Athabasca Watershed Council

National Association of Retired & Veteran Rail Employees (NARVRE)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Chuck Spafford and I'm currently serving as a Staff Sergeant in the Maryland Army National Guard as a Military Police Officer.  I'm a combat veteran of the war in Afghanistan.  There is a growing problem here in Maryland and I need your help to solve it.  Many of my brothers and sisters in arms are unemployed or severely underemployed.  The unemployment rate of military veterans in Maryland was 5.9% in 2013 - up from 5.3% in 2012.  I have a heavy burden to use my small business to advance this cause, but I need others to stand alongside me.

My wife and I own the Tyler Firearms Training Academy where we conduct self-defense training for individuals and groups throughout Maryland.  We want to expand our operations and create a new security guard agency so we can hire more veterans and National Guardsmen to give them the financial freedom to still be able to serve their country without fear of being docked in their paychecks or not receive raises or promotions based on their military service.  Our expanded training facility and security guard agency will allow currently serving National Guardsmen and military veterans to have jobs where their employer understands the military way of life, because we live the military way of life.

Your contribution will allow us to expand our current facility and hire 8 to 10 new veteran instructors, sales staff and support personnel.  We're also building a security guard agency where we can hire an additional 20 to 30 military veterans.  This is phase 2 of our plan, and we are confident that our expanded training facility will fund the start-up of the security guard agency.

What We Need & What You Get

To expand our existing facility and hire more veterans, we're estimating the cost to be $40,000.  My wife and I are investing $15,000 of our own money, so that leaves $25,000 that we need from you to get us started.  Once operational, the business will be able to support our ongoing operations.  We just need a little help to get us going - we can take care of the rest.  

This campaign will allow us to build out existing space, build a live-fire range for our classes, create a shoot house, expand our retail store, and begin the process of hiring 8 to 10 veterans for instructors, retail staff, and support personnel (all veterans).  We are opening the new facility on April 1st, 2015.

We will use the money for starting salaries of our new employees, sales and marketing efforts, new equipment, and insurance and license fees.  

  • License and insurance fees - $2,000
  • New facility modifications and range - $10,000
  • Training materials and training equipment - $3,000
  • Marketing - $5,000
  • Payroll and expenses - $20,000
For your generous contribution to our campaign, if you are in the Baltimore Maryland area, you can choose to attend our training facility or receive a personalized self-defense consultation in person.  If you are not able to come to our facility, we can arrange for your consultation over the phone or by video conference.  We will help you to build your personalized self-defense plan from the ground up and tailor it to meet your needs and budget.  All levels of contribution will include:
  • a personalized letter of thanks from our veterans;
  • a certificate of appreciation;
  • listed on our supporter page (optional); and
  • our never-ending gratitude.
Feel free to browse the perks we have for you and choose the one that best fits your desired level of participation.
The Impact

Your contribution to our campaign will help veterans get back to work - or stay working.  We as Servicemembers need a purpose.  When our military purpose ends, the desire to serve does not end.  You will be a huge part in the lives of veterans and their families.  They need help... help us to help them.

Risks & Challenges

There is very little competition in our area for the type of training we provide, but we will have a unique advantage of hiring seasoned combat veterans that served as military police and infantry Soldiers to bring real-world experiences to every class they teach.  They are no strangers to hard work, and will do what it takes to make sure each and every student is 100% satisfied with the training they receive.  In fact, it's guaranteed.  Any less than 100% customer satisfaction wouldn't be fair to our customers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out to help veterans and their families.  They served our country, now it's time for us to serve them.  I personally went into combat with an awful lot of Soldiers that I can't help with my existing business.  I need your help to grow and be able to hire them and give them a purpose again - a purpose of serving the people of this great country.

Use the share tools that Indiegogo has to offer.  Post it to your Facebook page, Tweet about it, email it to your friends and family.  Help us to help Maryland Veterans!

Thank you for taking your valuable time to read our proposal.  We hope to be able to meet each and every one of you soon!

story:
Short Summary

Hello my name is Damon Lawrence and I have been in the Hospitality Industry for about 8 years. I have worked in properties ranging from Motels to Luxury 5-Star properties all over the US during my career. Most recently I started a company called Hausotel, in which I manage vacation homes in Southern California. 


Many times I have been disappointed in the lack of African-American Management level employees at the hotel properties I’ve worked at. Even in predominately African American cities the representation, especially with Front of House employees, is very disparaging compared to our counterparts. So earlier this year, I decided that its time we had a hotel brand that reflects our history and represents our contribution to popular culture in America.

            Now, I present to you the Homage Hotel Group.

This campaign is raising the seed-round of capital in order for my team and I to secure the financing needed for our hotel project in Downtown Oakland, California.

Its no coincidence that we began our campaign in February! This month is Black History Month and we are giving our friends and supporters a chance to become a part of making Black History in the Travel & Leisure industry.

By contributing to our campaign you will be monumental in creating the first ever Black Owned Boutique Hotel Management company in the United States.

You indeed will be making Black History.


Hotel Inspiration

Pictured above is Mr. William Leidesdorff Jr. -The First Black Millionaire in America

HISTORICAL BACKDROP

In the mid 1800’s William Leidesdorff Jr., a man of Caribbean and Danish decent made the voyage from the Port of New Orleans to Yerba Buena (what is now San Francisco) during the age of sail. Leidesdorff was said to have been the last black seaman to make that journey, since soon after, the Negro Seamen's Act of 1822 was put in place. Once he arrived on the California coast, he wasted no time in taking on entrepreneurial endeavors. One of which was his opening of the City Hotel. The City Hotel was the first hotel in the region and was in place in what is now San Francisco’s financial district until it was burned down in the fire of 1851.

Our hotel will "Pay Homage" to the legacy of Mr. Leidesdorff who is considered to be the first black millionaire in America.

WHATS ON THE HORIZON

Homage Hotel Group is currently seeking funding for a full renovation project to include room interiors, themed restaurant, Lobby and Rooftop Bar as well as meetings and special event space. The locale for the project centers around Oakland, CA and the downtown city center.


The property will pay Homage to the history of William Liedesdorff Jr. by incorporating elements of his storied past into the culture of the operation. Hotel culture will take on the personality of Mr. Liedesdorff who “bore a high reputation for integrity and enterprise” and is said to have been "liberal, hospitable, cordial, confiding even to a fault.”

PROJECTED FEATURES

Hortense/Julia Ann’s Restaurant- Hortense is the name of the woman, who by calling off their wedding mere days before, broke William’s heart to the point he felt he needed to leave New Orleans. Julia Ann is the name of the boat William purchased in order to set sail for the West. Though the name is up in the air, the creole inspired theme of the restaurant is solidified through the narrative. The interior will be a vintage and eclectic resemblance of a sailors tavern. The menu will feature an expansive raw bar as well as creole inspired main dishes while featuring Liedesdorff’s love of fine wines and cuisine. 

Schooner’s Roof Top Bar - A schooner is a type of sailing vessel with fore-and-aft sails on two or more masts and the very type of vessel William Liedesdorff Jr. used to make his voyage. The roof top will be Oakland's first and will feature elements that resemble a schooner ship while making special note of Liedesdorff’s love for landscaping as his estate featured one of the largest flower gardens in all of California.

What We Need & Why?

Break it down for folks in more detail:
We are seeking $10,000 to assist us in taking the next step to make our hotel a reality. Most of that amount will go towards the legal fees associated with crowd funding an entire hotel project. Our next step will be to take our project to the City of Oakland and generate yet another crowd funding campaign. Only this time it will be Equity based so that investors can make a return on their investment. The funds from that campaign will aid in the purchase and renovation of our hotel.

Your funds will directly aid in the following:

  1. Legal Counsel and Securities Attorney fees
  2. Marketing Distribution Materials
  3. Collaborative Fundraising efforts
  4. Groundbreaker.co Crowd Funding Software

We have some pretty cool perks available for our campaign however we’re only just asking people to donate 10 dollars. The way we see it if we can get 1000 people to do such we can reach our goal rather seamlessly. But if interested check out the rest of the perks which include, Mugs, discounted stays and Friends & Family Discounts at our Oakland property.

The Impact

Look at these statistics:

African-American’s Buying Power Projected to be $1.1 Trillion in 2015. (blackenterprise.com)


If the spending power of African Americans were a country it would rank as the 16th Largest in the world right behind Mexico. (wikipedia.com)

African American spend $48 billion on travel in the United States alone (www.nytimes.com)


95% of the income of Blacks go to businesses outside of the Black community. (www.aef.com)


Our vision is to become the Black-Owned Leisure and Travel company in the world. Our first project will be in Oakland, CA but we look forward to expanding our product to cities across the United States and eventually resorts around the world.

The Next Step - Funding The Project


This is step one in the process. The end result will come from the collaborative effort of Real Estate Equity Crowdfunding courtesy of Groundbreaker.co and their world renowned software. We will allow Bay Area residents the opportunity to have ownership stake in the hotel equity in order to make this dream a reality.

We are looking to get the full support of the City of Oakland in making our hotel an integral part of the city culture.

Keep up with our website at www.homagehotelgroup.com going forward for more details.


Risks & Challenges


Starting January 27th, 2015 we entered into negotiations with a hotel property owner in Downtown Oakland. We anticipate having a purchase agreement signed in the next few weeks.

We are confident that we will be able to enter a purchase agreement and secure funding to make our dream a reality. Whether its this property or the others we are targeting we will have a finished hotel product to offer the world in 2016.


Other Ways You Can Help


If you cant contribute to our campaign maybe you know someone that is willing and able and we encourage you to forward our link to those individuals.

 to secure the financing needed for our hotel project in Downtown 
Oakland, California. Its no coincidence that we began our 
campaign in February! This month is Black History Month and we are 
giving our friends and supporters a chance to become a part of making 
Black History in the Travel & Leisure industry.By 
contributing to our campaign you will be monumental in creating the 
first ever Black Owned Boutique Hotel Management company in the United 
States. You indeed will be making Black History.Hotel Inspiration
Pictured above is Mr. William Leidesdorff Jr. -The First Black Millionaire in America

HISTORICAL BACKDROPIn
 the mid 1800’s William Leidesdorff Jr., a man of Caribbean and Danish 
decent made the voyage from the Port of New Orleans to Yerba Buena (what
 is now San Francisco) during the age of sail. Leidesdorff was said to 
have been the last black seaman to make that journey, since soon after, 
the Negro Seamen's Act of 1822 was put in place. Once he arrived on the 
California coast, he wasted no time in taking on entrepreneurial 
endeavors. One of which was his opening of the City Hotel. The City 
Hotel was the first hotel in the region and was in place in what is now 
San Francisco’s financial district until it was burned down in the fire 
of 1851. Our hotel will "Pay Homage" to the legacy of Mr. Leidesdorff who is considered to be the first black millionaire in America.
WHATS ON THE HORIZONHomage
 Hotel Group is currently seeking funding for a full renovation project 
to include room interiors, themed restaurant, Lobby and Rooftop Bar as 
well as meetings and special event space. The locale for the project 
centers around Oakland, CA and the downtown city center. The property will pay Homage to
 the history of William Liedesdorff Jr. by incorporating elements of his
 storied past into the culture of the operation. Hotel culture will take
 on the personality of Mr. Liedesdorff who “bore a high reputation for 
integrity and enterprise” and is said to have been "liberal, hospitable, cordial, confiding even to a fault.” PROJECTED FEATURESHortense/Julia Ann’s Restaurant- Hortense
 is the name of the woman, who by calling off their wedding mere days 
before, broke William’s heart to the point he felt he needed to leave 
New Orleans. Julia Ann is the name of the boat William purchased in 
order to set sail for the West. Though the name is up in the air, the 
creole inspired theme of the restaurant is solidified through the 
narrative. The interior will be a vintage and eclectic resemblance of a 
sailors tavern. The menu will feature an expansive raw bar as well as 
creole inspired main dishes while featuring Liedesdorff’s love of fine 
wines and cuisine. Schooner’s Roof Top Bar - A
 schooner is a type of sailing vessel with fore-and-aft sails on two or 
more masts and the very type of vessel William Liedesdorff Jr. used to 
make his voyage. The roof top will be Oakland's first and will feature elements that resemble a 
schooner ship while making special note of Liedesdorff’s love for 
landscaping as his estate featured one of the largest flower gardens in 
all of California. What We Need & Why?Break it down for folks in more detail:We
 are seeking $10,000 to assist us in taking the next step to make our 
hotel a reality. Most of that amount will go towards the legal fees associated with crowd funding an entire hotel project. Our next step will be to take our project to the City of Oakland and generate yet another crowd funding campaign. Only this time it will be Equity based so that investors can make a return on their investment. The funds from that campaign will aid in the purchase and renovation of our hotel. Your funds will directly aid in the following:
Legal Counsel and Securities Attorney fees
Marketing Distribution Materials

Collaborative Fundraising efforts
Groundbreaker.co Crowd Funding Software 
We
 have some pretty cool perks available for our campaign however we’re only just asking people to donate 10 dollars. The way we see it if we 
can get 1000 people to do such we can reach our goal rather seamlessly. 
But if interested check out the rest of the perks which include, Mugs, discounted stays and Friends & Family Discounts at 
our Oakland property. The ImpactLook at these statistics:African-American’s Buying Power Projected to be $1.1 Trillion in 2015. (blackenterprise.com)If the spending power of African Americans were a country it would rank as the 16th Largest in the world right behind Mexico. (wikipedia.com)
African American spend $48 billion on travel in the United States alone (www.nytimes.com)95% of the income of Blacks go to businesses outside of the Black community. (www.aef.com)Our
 vision is to become the Black-Owned Leisure and Travel company in the 
world. Our first project will be in Oakland, CA but we look forward to 
expanding our product to cities across the United States and eventually 
resorts around the world. The Next Step - Funding The ProjectThis
 is step one in the process. The end result will come from the 
collaborative effort of Real Estate Equity Crowdfunding courtesy of 
Groundbreaker.co and their world renowned software. We will allow Bay 
Area residents the opportunity to have ownership stake in the hotel 
equity in order to make this dream a reality. We are looking to get the full support of the City of Oakland in making our hotel an integral part of the city culture. Keep up with our website at www.homagehotelgroup.com going forward for more details. Risks & ChallengesStarting
 January 27th, 2015 we entered into negotiations with a hotel property 
owner in Downtown Oakland. We anticipate having a purchase agreement 
signed in the next few weeks. We are confident that we will be 
able to enter a purchase agreement and secure funding to make our dream a
 reality. Whether its this property or the others we are targeting we 
will have a finished hotel product to offer the world in 2016.Other Ways You Can HelpIf
 you cant contribute to our campaign maybe you know someone that is 
willing and able and we encourage you to forward our link to those 
individuals.

story:
OUR STORY!!

Hello!! I am Douglas Blackwood, a 52 year old veteran with 20 years of service. After retiring from the U.S. Airforce, I was fortunate to be able to transfer my service experience to civilian life but unfortunately many of our returning heroes will not have that same good fortune. Despite what the fancy recruitment ads profess a good portion of the military jobs do not have a good civilian equivalent, army infantry or armor for instance. There is also little opportunity to attend school because they are very often in the field training or sitting in the desert in some austere part of the world serving their country doing the job they were hired for.
The last 6 years of my life have not gone the best, I experienced problems with my family that led to divorce after 24 years of marriage. The same ole financially destabilizing stories that happen to separating couples happened to me and now I am stuck in what seems like a never ending rut that I continually try to crawl out of.  I could share my whole depressing story but I am not here for pity. That is not me! I was always successful, the go to guy, able to help others, myself, and most importantly take care of my family. 

My son who is in the Army now, preparing to deploy to a location in the middle east has really made me want to get out of my rut more than ever. He and I were having a conversation one day and he told me that after his 9 months in the desert are over his enlistment will be up.  His fear is that he has no idea what to do for a job when he gets out.  He is great with weapons, driving a Bradley, land navigation, etc., but how is that going to get him a job when he gets out?  His fellow soldiers have the same problem. At that moment I knew I had to help him and other returning heroes. 

I soul searched my life and examined the things I was good at, what I made money at with little effort. I used to be a licensed Realtor and have experience buying, selling, being my own project manager for hiring contractors to fix up houses to sell, obtaining building permits and scheduling the final inspections and Certificate of Occupancy. 

MAKING IT HAPPEN!!

I realized I could help myself be happy again, help my son and others at the same time. The issue with this as with all dreams of substance involve money. Unfortunately, I can not borrow enough to get started. With help from all of you I would like to- 

  • Help a small team of veterans use there benefits and go to the necessary schools to obtain their license.
  • Hire unlicensed vets to do work they are legally allowed with supervision.
  • Work with the American Legion, Veterans of Foreign Wars and other veterans groups.
  • Purchase distressed and foreclosed homes, rehab and sell.
  • Repeat.

The donations would be used to-

  • Aid the trainees with tuition and license fees as needed.
  • Pay wages.
  • Advertising.
  • Property search, down payment, closing cost.
  • Security for loans or outright purchase if deal is right.
  • Licensed contractors as needed with the ultimate goal of needing no outside help so we are a self-contained team.
  • Building permits and fees.
  • Building Materials, Landscaping.
  • Business License.
  • Realtor Fees.
  • Unexpected costs.
The real-estate market has never been more flush with properties that offer the necessary profit margins to make this type of self-sustaining business possible. I have a solid full time job so I would be able to use all donated funds toward the business and necessary training. My son already trained in leadership and management, especially small teams, would be my full time foreman. He also has experience in construction prior to going into the army. I would oversee all aspects of the business.
I hope to get more than the amount of money I have wished for. If I get less than needed I will reevaluate my plan and see if what I did receive can make me attractive enough to a lender to get traditional loans. This of course will slow down my veterans training program as there will not be funds to pay them a wage to live on and I will have to work more vets in as each house is sold.  
As many of you already know, once you start pulling down walls and pulling apart kitchens and baths surprises always appear.  The donated funds are also for these unexpected expenses. I do have 30 years experience in management between military and civilian life, have started and helped my ex-wife run a successful business since 2003, which is still doing great to this day. I have flipped houses before and am familiar with the permitting and inspection code.
Your donations will help me finally crawl out of my rut and also help our returning and current veterans who often feel lost and do not know how to get on with their lives. 
What is in it for you? The satisfaction and good feeling you get inside from knowing you helped make a difference in someones life. Kept them off the street and out of trouble. A contributing member of society.  When I used to teach kids martial arts and I was asked one day, if I got tired of putting so many hours into it because I was not making any money as most of the kids could not afford the tuition and were free,  I used to say, "If we can save just one of these kids, it is worth it."

YOUR HELP!!

Please help us today with your $1, $2, $5, $10, $25, $50, $75, $100, $200, $500, $1000 or more donation. Anything helps reach the goal!! Remember if you can not contribute but would like to help, share this campaign with your friends and family!!

story:
Garden Station is a whimsical community garden, art park and sustainable living education center in the heart of downtown Dayton, Ohio created entirely by volunteers.

We feature sustainable buildings on pounded tire foundations with straw bale, bottle wall and green roof. Local artists have created murals to cover about 400' of wall as well as sculptures and mosaics. We have wheelchair accessible garden plots and a market garden that grows produce for our Sunday Market and seniors at Jaycee Towers. We have an outdoor kitchen for events and classes and permaculture demonstration projects including a food forest, herb spiral and hugelkultur swales. We also have helped establish an urban farmer's group and ran a 23 week urban farmer's market the past 3 years, as well as taught over 60 FREE sustainable living workshops every year.

Garden Station has been created by over 2000 volunteers and donations from over 150 local businesses and organizations with no paid staff or budget and truly represents the heart and soul of our community!

2013 was our first EarthFest. It started as a larger farmer’s market with a non-Monsanto plant and seed sale and free workshops, and ended up being an 8 hour long festival with about 1000 people attending 30+ workshops, enjoying 6 local bands, vendors/info booths from 30 community organizations with food trucks, the Really Really Free Market and the Great Cloth Diaper Change to boot! Last year over 4000 people attended and over 80 organizations participated! EarthFest is now the LARGEST Earth Day event in the Miami Valley!

The community was SO generous and raised about $2500 to put on this amazing event plus groups donated the programs, posters, raffle prizes and more! Over half of that money went towards advertising on WYSO, DMM and the City Paper and $600 went to pay 6 local bands, plus we had some printing costs for posters and signs and rented tents.

It would be nice to raise enough this year to pay our workshop teachers a small stipend for supplies since they did it all as volunteers and donated materials from their own pockets last year.

$30/ workshop x 30 workshops = $900

It would be great to have more tents and or heaters in case of bad weather which can add up costs quickly. We would like to expand our advertising and we would  also like to videotape the workshops to play on DATV so even more people can learn how to “go a shade greener”! 

For more info on last year’s event and the program see https://www.facebook.com/events/1394943604074830/

https://www.facebook.com/GardenStation/photos/pcb.1465266750375848/10152134588632971/?type=1&theater

Photos from EarthFest 2014 https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.10152144872687971.1073741839.105606052970&type=3

The whole purpose of the event is to provide basic, easy to use, hands on information to help our residents “go a shade greener”, make us all more self-sufficient, help our region become more resilient and move towards reducing our carbon footprint. This event will help our neighbors connect with local organizations that can help them on their ongoing quest to become more sustainable and it will connect our local organizations to each other for future collaborations and sharing of resources."

We are looking for green-focused individuals and organizations to help sponsor the event! Your contribution will go to advertise EarthFest 2015 to the entire Miami Valley area through WYSO, DMM and more! Our Sponsors are interested in educating our residents to live in a more sustainable manner and we feel that this free community educational event is a great value that will produce great results in our community!

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Your gift of $350 will sponsor a classroom for 7.5 hours of free sustainable living workshops for EarthFest 2015 to help residents from our community “go a shade greener”! Our workshops will be geared to give hands-on, easy to use info that can be used right away to help people become more self-sufficient. The classroom will be named after you or your organization i.e. The Roy Berlin Classroom; and will appear in the program with the schedule for the day. Your Logo and or name will also appear on the event posters and website. This money will go towards advertising the event to attract more people and for printing and event expenses, not for staffing.

Your gift of $750 will sponsor the music stage featuring local musicians for EarthFest 2015. The stage will be named after you or your organization i.e. The Roy Berlin Music Stage; and will appear in the program with the schedule for the day. Your Logo and or name will also appear on the event posters and website. This money will go directly to the participating musicians as a small stipend for their expenses.

Your gift of $100 will be listed on the program and website as a sponsor, you will receive a $15 gift certificate and you will be able to pick two 3-packs of plants of your choice at our non-GMO, non-Monsanto varieties Plant Sale during EarthFest 2015

Your gift of $75 will be listed on the website as a supporter and you will receive a $10 gift certificate and one 3-pack of a plant of your choice at our non-GMO, non-Monsanto varieties Plant Sale during EarthFest 2015.

Your gift of $50 will be listed on the website as a supporter and you will receive one 3-pack of a plant of your choice at our non-GMO, non-Monsanto varieties Plant Sale during EarthFest 2015.

Your gift of $30 will be listed on the website as a friend and you will receive one heirloom tomato plant at our non-GMO, non-Monsanto varieties Plant Sale during EarthFest 2015.

Any donations above and beyond our EarthFest expenses will help us build a hoophouse to expand our urban farm at Garden Station where we can grow fresh, local sustainable food for our community!

ALL donors will be publicly appreciated on our Facebook page www.facebook.com/gardenstation and at any level you can feel great about doing your part to help make our community more sustainable!

LOVE IT but can’t give money? We need volunteers! 

Contact us at daytongardenstation@gmail.com

Want to DONATE AN ITEM instead? We are accepting items for a raffle at EarthFest to raise money for continuing events and construction at Garden Station.

Contact us at daytongardenstation@gmail.com

SPREAD THE WORD! Share our event and fundraiser on Facebook and other social media!

This year's event page is here:

https://www.facebook.com/events/720176541399168/  

THANKS! For your help in making our community a little greener! :)

www.GoAShadeGreener.org

story:
Little about us:

Like the majority of you, we both, Pankaj and Pallav resemble an average personage. Going through the life’s moments, we did experience our share of its ups and downs, happiness and challenges but most importantly of all, like some of you, we didn’t give up on our dreams. The harder it became, the bigger we dreamt!!

We are exactly like you or everyone else in the world - like most entrepreneurial India stories – we are in our early/mid-thirties, we come from a middle class background, have family & kids. We typically hangout with like-minded friends and unlike what happens in the real world, we solve the gravest of the world’s problem over a peg. We believe, “To solve the problems always count on your spirit!! (Pun intended), but again like everyone else our gutsy version of fighting world’s worst nightmare bare knuckle, used to die right after the last peg or probably when we used to wake up with hangover. 

Everything was mundane, indifferent and constant when finally our moment of calling had come. We then took the most impractical decision of our life. After failing twice in our earlier ventures, we decided to give up on our routine comfortable life that had more than decent fixed income just to follow what world calls ‘living your dream’ and ‘following your passion’.

Choose what you may to define what we two lesser mortals did, but 24 months after we took that plunge, life has changed for the better. We are living our dreams and we are dreaming even bigger. CityShor.com, is not a dream anymore, it’s an embodiment of passion of two men and their desire to live their dreams. Simply put, its what you get, should you take that small little but important first step to pursue your life’s calling. 

Little about our dream:

It would be unfair if we tell you that we knew CityShor’s success right from day one. That’s not true. We started with very vague thoughts:

  1. We were just trying to plug a problem that people didn’t even know existed.
  2. We wanted to create a simple and beautiful product.
  3. We wanted to do something really different – something which is first of its kind. 
  4. And we wanted to impact lives in literal sense in whatever little way possible.

Like everyone else and as lot of articles on internet suggested, we made business plans, we estimated our revenues, and we crunched some numbers to show how many users would follow us, how will we tell the world about our innovative product ... But honestly nothing worked as per plan … our revenue sources went for a toss completely but fortunately it turned out much better than our plans on paper. Through CityShor.com – we are proud to say that yes we exactly got what we wanted… rather more except few things. But then hey, what’s life without a pinch of salt.  


Current Situation: (if you think we bragging, its purely intentional and not fictional!!)

Today, CityShor is followed by more than 10% of local youth in Ahmedabad and we are the Largest Online Media Company in Ahmedabad. Users just don’t like our products but they love us (there are always few exceptions in life), worked with more than 600+ retailers – they believe we are the most effective and only possible medium to increase their business. 

Few User Testimonials:

 

Success Stories of local businesses:


Few inside figures show us that our growth numbers are much better than today’s some of the well known start-ups of India – if we compare their first two years and ours.

Are we successful – yes we are. Are we happy? – Yes we are. But Are we satisfied? – Nope. The appetite has grown, The resolve even stronger.

After two years, we have again dreamt of doing something huge. And with this new dream, we wish to break all the world records. 


Our new dream:

Today with just 10% of local youth following us, we are the largest media company in Ahmedabad; however, we wish to grow more and want to break all the world records. We wish 50% of local youth of Ahmedabad should know and get the benefit of CityShor’s product.

Currently with more than 1,50,000 people (more than 10% of local youth on Facebook) following us, we have radically change the way a local knows and explores its city. Likewise, we have dramatically changed the way a small to mid-size local retailer showcases its art and product to Ahmedabad. We make local business feel like an MNC which would never have been possible without CityShor.

Imagine how much we can change if we are able to take 1, 50, 000 to 6, 00, 000 – yes more than 50% of local youth on Facebook.

Exactly, that’s our new dream. To acquire more than 50% of local youth on Facebook and break all the world records and we need your help for that.


Why should you care?

Why shouldn’t you? After all, you didn’t read all the above because it was shit!!!  Now that we got your attention, don’t shy away. Stick on and be a part of history.

Won’t you like to support a home grown company… a company which is creating a history … 2 people … 2 laptops … no financial backing… already a largest online media company in Ahmedabad… won’t you like to be a part of the history.

Well, if the above logic is still not convincing, please know that for whatever contribution you make, we will gift you something back which is of equal or higher amount. Please check out right hand side of this page for different perks that we have on offer for you.

And we are not asking world from you. We are fine with whatever is possible from you – Rs. 250/- , Rs. 500/- or anything. And if nothing else, just share our video so that we can reach out to maximum possible people with our pitch.

Wondering why do we need money… aren’t we earning? Well, read on…


What would we do with your contribution / money?

Wondering why do we need money… aren’t we earning? Well, we are earning and we are earning pretty decent. However, the kind of target and dream that we have for us is pretty steep and huge. It requires huge number of team members, lot of ground level activities, lot of feet on street exercise and basically approaching huge masses of Ahmedabad … introducing them to what CityShor is and finally convincing them to start following us.

You believe it’s a small task… well, it’s not.

This is the exact place where we are going to spend your money on. Basically to build your own company, to reach to 50% of local youth.


Other ways to help

Any kind of help is appreciated. If you are unable to help us monetarily… help us just by spreading the word about our campaign by talking to your friends and family, by liking the video, by liking our Facebook page or by following us on Twitter or Instagram, by subscribing to our WhatsApp number or by sharing this video.
story_txt:
Little about us:
Like the majority of you, we both, Pankaj and Pallav resemble an average
personage. Going through the life’s moments, we did experience our share of its
ups and downs, happiness and challenges but most importantly of all, like some
of you, we didn’t give up on our dreams. The harder it became, the bigger we
dreamt!!

We are exactly like you or everyone else in the world - like most entrepreneurial
India stories – we are in our early/mid-thirties, we come from a middle class
background, have family & kids. We typically hangout with like-minded friends
and unlike what happens in the real world, we solve the gravest of the world’s problem
over a peg. We believe, “To solve the problems always count on your spirit!!
(Pun intended), but again like everyone else our gutsy version of fighting
world’s worst nightmare bare knuckle, used to die right after the last peg or
probably when we used to wake up with hangover. 
Everything was mundane, indifferent and constant when finally our moment
of calling had come. We then took the most impractical decision of our life.
After failing twice in our earlier ventures, we decided to give up on our
routine comfortable life that had more than decent fixed income just to follow
what world calls ‘living your dream’ and ‘following your passion’. 
Choose
what you may to define what we two lesser mortals did, but 24 months after we
took that plunge, life has changed for the better. We are living our dreams and
we are dreaming even bigger. CityShor.com, is not a dream anymore, it’s an
embodiment of passion of two men and their desire to live their dreams. Simply
put, its what you get, should you take that small little but important first
step to pursue your life’s calling. 

Little about our dream:
It would be unfair if we tell you that we knew CityShor’s success right
from day one. That’s not true. We started with very vague thoughts:




We were just trying to plug a problem that people didn’t even know existed.


We wanted to create a simple and beautiful product.


We wanted to do something really different – something which is first of its kind. 


And we wanted to impact lives in literal sense in whatever little way possible.


Like
everyone else and as lot of articles on internet suggested, we made business
plans, we estimated our revenues, and we crunched some numbers to show how many
users would follow us, how will we tell the world about our innovative product ...
But honestly nothing worked as per plan … our revenue sources went for a toss
completely but fortunately it turned out much better than our plans on paper.
Through CityShor.com – we are proud to say that yes we exactly got what we
wanted… rather more except few things. But then hey, what’s life without a
pinch of salt.  


Current Situation: (if you think we
bragging, its purely intentional and not fictional!!)

Today,
CityShor is followed by more than 10% of local youth in Ahmedabad and we are
the Largest Online Media Company in Ahmedabad. Users just don’t like our
products but they love us (there are always few exceptions in life), worked
with more than 600+ retailers – they believe we are the most effective and only
possible medium to increase their business.

story:
Imagine if you could log in to a web site and find other couch surfers from everywhere you want, regardless of what networks they used in the past.

  • What if you didn't have to deal with spam, or lots of questions from beginners that didn't read the rules of the discussion groups and ask obvious questions.
  • What if you could see all the events, from anywhere you like, even the ones in networks that you are not even a member of yet.
  • What if finding a host was much easier and predictable, and you didn't have to send couch requests to dozens of people in the hope that at least one will respond?

Imagine how it would be if all those services could be used completely free of charge!


Hospitality Gift is the future of couch surfing!

  • Powerful safety features!
  • New strategies to improve the safety of both hosts and couch surfers.
  • New ways to find and promote couch surfing related events.
  • Profiles with useful information.
  • User groups that are well managed, relevant in their contents, and easy to use.

HOW IT WORKS

Our development team has plenty of experience in connecting different web sites. We will start with Facebook, Couchsurfing, BeWelcome, Trustroots, Twitter, and MeetUp. Once you sign up you will be able to see already several resources to build up a very useful and effective profile, resources to connect to your couch surfing friends, and plenty of instructions on how to use the resources of the new web site.

You will then be able to communicate with other members using our discussion groups, search for accommodations if you are planning a trip, and find events at any location you want.


RESOURCEFUL, EASY, AND AD-FREE

We like simple and modern user interfaces. The web page will work flawlessly on any browser, and in any platform. Even on smartphones and tablets it should present without a problem.

In a second phase we will be building the Apps for iPhones and Androids.

We are not considering advertising as a source of revenue.


ALL FEATURES AVAILABLE FOR FREE

There will be no features that you have to pay for. Every improvement and resource will be available for everyone. No advertising means that we will be able to stay neutral and never mislead our couch surfers either by pushing a product or service that is not the best, or by omission. We will allow users to make recommendations of products of services they like, or list services they recommend. But there will be very clear guidelines for that, and a watchful community that doesn't want to see yet another great site be invaded by SPAM. 

All the money to run everything will come from donations and crowfunding. Just like Wikipedia and some other web sites do. They are community resources, so they live out of the generosity of those that can afford more.

We believe that people from a poor country, where a few dollars can make a big difference, should not be barred from using the services of Hospitality Gift because they can't afford a "verification" fee, or pay for premium services, or because they don't have a credit card to sign up.


WHAT WE HAVE NOW

We have a core team of developers, ready to start. We have access to powerful hi-capacity servers that should allow us to run tests and accept several thousand users without slowing down the site. We also have access to databases and cloud storage enough for development and testing.

We have the general design done, most of it is outlined on our web page http://Hospitality.Gift so you can read about it now.


WHAT DO WE NEED

When the new web site is launched, the number of users will not be just a few. We estimate the number of signups may reach hundreds of thousands in just the first few weeks. Because we tap into the traffic of messages and data between several web sites, the number of group messages, interactions, notifications, and searches can be in the millions a day within a matter of weeks as well.

We need fund to pay some of the outside developers and we will need to contract with enterprise level web services, cloud services, and database providers and they can be expensive. Security will also have to be taken very seriously and that doesn't come cheap.


TIMELINE

Setting up the corporate structure as a Public Benefit Corporation, as explained on our web page should be done by the end of March.

First beta tests should be happening during the months of April and May.

Final rollout and official opening to the public by the end of June.


WE NEED YOUR HELP NOW!

We can't do it alone. We don't have the resources to take people out of their full time jobs and ask them to help us develop this system working intensely for about 4 months without any money. We also need to make sure we start with the kind of servers necessary for a project of this magnitude.

It would be horrible to see a system like this have a lot of new users sign up because they like the features and services, and then see errors because the servers cannot take the load. Remember "502 Bad Gateway"?

So we need you to bet on us. We are not asking for much, considering the incredible benefits that the couch surfing lifestyle gives you. We will show you what we are developing and it won't take long for you to realize that you made the best bet of your life!


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute with money, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask your friends that love travel and understand hospitality exchange and pay-it-forward to come to our web page and our campaign.
  • Ask them to support us!


Thank you!

It would be horrible to see a system like this have a lot of new users sign up because they like the features and services, and then see errors because the servers cannot take the load. Remember "502 Bad Gateway"?
So we need you to bet on us. We are not asking for much, considering the incredible benefits that the couch surfing lifestyle gives you. We will show you what we are developing and it won't take long for you to realize that you made the best bet of your life!



Other Ways You Can Help

 Some people just can't contribute with money, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask your friends that love travel and understand hospitality exchange and pay-it-forward to come to our web page and our campaign. Ask them to support us!   Thank you!

story:
A Word from the Founder

In all my years of consulting faith-based content creators, the thing that frustrated me the most was that my clients were unintentionally creating life-changing content with limits. Primarily, only their congregations, partners and supporters would access it. In order to enjoy these "gifts", you had to attend the events or buy their products at these events. If you lived across country and had the good fortune to hear about this ministry, or if you wanted to share content with a friend, you either mailed them CDs and DVDs via snail mail or were at the mercy of the beasts that are mass video platforms to find their content. 

Access and brand awareness are issues for established and upcoming Christian influencers across the board. Whether you are an established ministry, clean comedian, filmmaker, musician, evangelist or entertainer, existing broadcast mediums are either relatively limited or are not focused on offering a portal that is dedicated to the community of faith. 

At MyWordCentral, distribution of Faith-Based content is our only focus. With your help, we will change the way Christian content is consumed for years to come! 

The problem with current video content platforms:

  • Millions of irrelevant and distracting video content make finding enriching and uplifting content difficult.
  • Lacks a true focus of enriching and transforming people
  • Old process that lacks the intelligence to provide personally-progressive content.

There is a solution to these problems and the answer is MyWordCentral:

A faith-based OTT (Over the Top) video platform created to organize and provide access to premium content on life, love and family.

MyWordCentral exists to:

  • Capture and organize all of the faith-based content scattered around the web
  • Curate premium content from content creators for streaming, renting and downloading (ownership) by the faith-based community 
  • Offer content that is fulfilling and faith-driven
  • Provide a family friendly experience
  • Develop the content to be accessible through multiple means of consumption



The Goals

Our goal is to raise at least $5,000 to build the 1st version, or beta as many would call it, of MyWordCentral. We want to bring great content to every screen and to do that we'll need your help. In the faith community, we want YOU to walk with us through this journey and truly know that you had a hand in the creation and launch of MyWordCentral.

Realizing that we can't do this on our own, we contracted an impressive group of engineers, designers and marketing experts that are creating a preliminary version product. Working with the team described below will ensure that we get off to a strong start. They have ample experience in delivering quality products and understand the audience and the problems.


The Team

Let's start with our new development partners Nuracode! Nuracode is an Atlanta based application development and technology innovations studio. Their specialties are emerging technologies, mobile application development and application integrations. That's a fancy way of saying they design and build applications and so far they've completed products for an impressive roster! Check out some of their clients below. Or on their website.

Inflex Digital is a digital first marketing and strategic insights consultancy located in Atlanta, Georgia. I met Justin, founder of Inflex Digital, after watching him discuss the future of media on TV One's NewsOne Now with Roland Martin! After a few conversations and the opportunity to meet the team I knew that this was the team to help us launch the vision placed on my heart!

The Product Rewards

As part of our fundraiser we decided the best reward would be the product itself. Initially priced at just $3.99 per month we believe organizing the Internet's Faith-based content is worth every penny. However, we know you want more, and so do we! We'll deliver premium content from our content creators, as well as develop  original MyWordCentral produced content. The more we deliver to you what you want, the better you respond to it, the more we can do. 

With that said, we are offering great incentive for you to support us early! 


Stretch Goals

Whether it's to offer you supplemental content for your personal journey or simply better options for your family, we believe MyWordCentral will be the premiere destination to consume Faith-based content. With this in mind, we created stretch goals that will enable us to integrate more content and features into our desktop and mobile products. Let's see how far we can go!

With more, we can do more!
$10K Goal Resources to
  • Build the mobile applications (android and iOS)
  • Content, Content, Content! Increase staff to discover, curate and add fresh new content to the MWC system.
$15K Goal Add Functionality
  • Playlist (save playlist to account)
  • Did we mention content? Each funding level allows us to bring on additional team members to add and organize content to the platform.
$20K Goal Resources to
  • Offline Access to Content (save to device)
  • Chromecast Enablement
  • Viewer Profiles (more viewers per device)
  • My Channels

story:
What’s GUUTEX? 　http://guutex.com/

We create transcripts for useful and valuable videos that are readily available all over the web. We will translate these transcripts into other languages and our main purpose is to provide a platformwhere ideas and knowledge can be shared from around the world.


Why create transcripts from videos?

“書き起こし (Kakiokoshi)”, which means writing down transcripts, is popular in Japan. You may be interested in watching various relevant videos, but it is very time-consuming to watch all of them. Having the transcripts of the videos to readcan help you to save a lot of time. Having transcripts also has a great advantage of reading it anytime and anywhere, like while waiting for the train! We live in a fast-paced society. It is probably difficult to spare 30 minutes of your time to watch a great video when you are busy, however you can easily make time for 5 minutes to read the transcripts. Plus, you can download transcripts quickly even if your connection is bad. As the majority of people in the world still cannot have access to high speed internet, having videos transcriptsis a huge potential. 


What’s the articles about? 

We will create articles (transcripts) from videos under the Creative Commons License or with the approval of copyright holders. We also have incredible “Media Partners”, to which we continuously provide transcripts. For example, Y Combinator, one of the most famous venture capitalist in the world, Derek Sivers, one of the best TED speaker and Kenichiro Mogi, one of the most famous scientist. Furthermore, GUUTEX also supports a diverse range of categories such as in: business, design, entertainment, global Issues, and science and technology.


Why transcripts media website?

GUUTEX is operated by three Japanese guys who met in Singapore. In Japan media websites which provide transcripts are getting very popular, but there is no similar service outside of Japan. We have analyzed the qualities of users, such as average session duration and bounce rate, and it was revealed that there was no significant difference between English users and Japanese users. The population of English-speaking country is more than 10 times larger than that of Japan. We believe the PV in English-speaking country would be over 20 milion PV per month. There is a huge potential in the English market and it our aim to be the best transcript media provider in the world.



What we can?

The origin of the name, GUUTEX, is a combined word made of ”Gutenberg” and “Text”. Johannes Gutenberg was the first European to use movable type printing which allowed people to share their ideas immediately. We aspire to be Gutenberg of our time. We want to spread valuable ideas to the world. We currently support two languages, English and Japanese. In the near future, we will be able to support Chinese, Spanish, French…perhaps of any languages of your choice! Our mission is to disseminate various ideas via texts/transcripts in different languages in order for information to reach out to a larger audience and to move mankind forward.


Why funding?

We will use the fund to develop the website, to host the server and to hire people. You can be a witness of our history!

=================================

GUUTEXとは？　http://guutex.com/?lang=ja

GUUTEXは、WEB上にある世界中の動画の中から有益なものを書き起こし、さらに多くの人達に読んでもらえるように各言語に翻訳します。世界中の優れた情報や知識の集まるメディアになることを目指します。


なぜ動画から書き起こすのか？

 例えば興味深い動画を見つけても、それを見る時間を作ることが困難な時があります。しかし動画から書き起こしたテキストならば、電車を待っているスキマ時間など、いつでもどこでも簡単に情報を得ることができます。忙しい現代人の我々にとって、動画を見る30分は難しくても、テキストを読む5分は日常のスキマ時間から創出できます。また世界では日本と違い、インターネット環境が十分に整っていない地域がたくさんあります。そういったユーザーも動画閲覧より、書き起こしのほうが情報を取得しやすいことからも、書き起こしサイトのポテンシャルは非常に大きいと考えています。


どんな記事を書くのか？

GUUTEXはクリエイティブ・コモンズ・ライセンス(著作者が著作物の再利用を許可しているもの)の動画と、著作者から直接、使用の許諾を頂いた動画のみを書き起こしています。これは「まとめサイト」など、昨今のWEB上における著作権軽視を問題だと捉えているからです。またGUUTEXには、所有する全ての動画の使用に許諾頂いた”メディアパートナー”がいます。シリコンバレーで最も有名なベンチャーキャピタルの1つであるYコンビネーター、TEDで最も有名なスピーカーの1人であるデレク・シヴァーズ氏、脳科学者として有名な茂木健一郎氏など魅力的なパートナーを揃えています。書き起こす動画のジャンルは、ビジネス、国際問題、自己啓発、デザイン、科学技術など多岐に渡ります。 


なぜ書き起こしのサイトを運営するのか？

GUUTEXではシンガポールで出会った日本人3人で運営されています。日本では現在、いくつかの書き起こしサイトが人気を博しています。GUUTEXには日本語と英語の記事がありますが、ユーザーの質という点からは、ほぼ相違が見られません。これは英語圏でも日本と同じように書き起こしメディアが受け入れられるというポテンシャルを秘めていると考えられます。英語圏で著名な書き起こしメディアが未だに存在しない現状を考慮すると、月間1000万～2000万PVの規模に成長する市場だと捉えています。そのため私たちは、最速で世界トップの書き起こしサイトになることを目指しています。


GUUTEXにできることは？

GUUTEXの名前の由来は、グーテンベルク(Gutenberg)とテキスト(Text)にあります。グーテンベルクは約600年前にヨーロッパで初めて活版印刷を発明した人物で、その影響により様々なアイディアが急速に広がっていきました。GUUTEXも同じような衝撃を、この21世紀の世界に与えたいという意味が込められています。そのために価値ある情報を世界中に広めていきます。現在は英語と日本語の2ヶ国語対応ですが、将来的には中国語、スペイン語、フランス語などあらゆる言語に対応することを目指しています。私たちのミッションは様々な情報や知識を、翻訳・書き起こしを通して世界中の人に広め、人類を前進させることです。 


なぜ投資を募るか？

 現在はポケットマネーで運営している状況です。そのため開発費、サーバー費、人件費をこちらで集めるために応募しました。”GUUTEX”という歴史の目撃者になるのは、あなたです！
story_txt:
What’s GUUTEX? 　http://guutex.com/
We create transcripts for useful and valuable videos that are readily available all over the web. We will translate these transcripts into other languages and our main purpose is to provide a platformwhere ideas and knowledge can be shared from around the world.Why create transcripts from videos?“書き起こし (Kakiokoshi)”, which means writing down transcripts, is popular in Japan. You may be interested in watching various relevant videos, but it is very time-consuming to watch all of them. Having the transcripts of the videos to readcan help you to save a lot of time. Having transcripts also has a great advantage of reading it anytime and anywhere, like while waiting for the train! We live in a fast-paced society. It is probably difficult to spare 30 minutes of your time to watch a great video when you are busy, however you can easily make time for 5 minutes to read the transcripts. Plus, you can download transcripts quickly even if your connection is bad. As the majority of people in the world still cannot have access to high speed internet, having videos transcriptsis a huge potential. 

What’s the articles about? 
We will create articles (transcripts) from videos under the Creative Commons License or with the approval of copyright holders. We also have incredible “Media Partners”, to which we continuously provide transcripts. For example, Y Combinator, one of the most famous venture capitalist in the world, Derek Sivers, one of the best TED speaker and Kenichiro Mogi, one of the most famous scientist. Furthermore, GUUTEX also supports a diverse range of categories such as in: business, design, entertainment, global Issues, and science and technology.



Why transcripts media website?
GUUTEX is operated by three Japanese guys who met in Singapore. In Japan media websites which provide transcripts are getting very popular, but there is no similar service outside of Japan. We have analyzed the qualities of users, such as average session duration and bounce rate, and it was revealed that there was no significant difference between English users and Japanese users. The population of English-speaking country is more than 10 times larger than that of Japan. We believe the PV in English-speaking country would be over 20 milion PV per month. There is a huge potential in the English market and it our aim to be the best transcript media provider in the world.




What we can?

The origin of the name, GUUTEX, is a combined word made of ”Gutenberg” and “Text”. Johannes Gutenberg was the first European to use movable type printing which allowed people to share their ideas immediately. We aspire to be Gutenberg of our time. We want to spread valuable ideas to the world. We currently support two languages, English and Japanese. In the near future, we will be able to support Chinese, Spanish, French…perhaps of any languages of your choice! Our mission is to disseminate various ideas via texts/transcripts in different languages in order for information to reach out to a larger audience and to move mankind forward.

Why funding?
We will use the fund to develop the website, to host the server and to hire people. You can be a witness of our history!
=================================
