story:
Starting The Zany Du Print Mobile Engine.

Zany Du Designs originated in a run-down garage next to my first post-college apartment in Wisconsin. I graduated with a BA in Graphic Design and wanted to keep working with my hands to balance the time spent designing in front of a computer. I had squeezed in an independent study screen printing class on top of my already heavy-work load my last semester of college. I desperately wanted to learn the basics of screen printing. In high school I had tried my hand at screen printing by using nylon stockings and an embroidery hoop until later receiving an introductory kit as a gift - the BEST gift I've ever gotten. I took the kit to college where I insisted on printing t-shirts for a softball team in my dorm as well as my friend's up and coming rock band. I was hooked!

Zany Du has been my artistic outlet for years providing me with numerous learning experiences and opportunities to meet new people. The markets and shows are where I feel most in my element. After moving to Jacksonville in the summer of 2014, I took a job at a Screen Printing company where I mastered all the tricks of the trade and had a blast printing on site at festivals and events. With your help I can take Zany Du from the garage to the streets! It's my dream to combine my love for screen printing with my love of travel and meeting new and interesting people. 

The Zany Du Print Mobile: What is it?

The Zany Du Print Mobile is a vehicle for preserving customized memories. In other words I want to drive around in a food truck/retro trailer type vehicle screen printing on site and selling already printed items in a boutique setting. Besides attending markets and fairs with my own designs the Zany Du Print Mobile would be an exciting way to commemorate events such as weddings, reunions, corporate events, grand openings, holiday parties, sporting events, music festivals, school fundraising events, active living community social events and so much more! The Zany Du Print Mobile would come to you with 1-4 designs to print on t-shirts, tote bags, beverage cozies and more! You can choose 1- 4 of your own designs or have Zany Du create them, making each outing and event totally unique and fun for all ages!

The Plan:

To get my dream off the ground I plan to attend One Spark - a crowd-funding festival in Jacksonville, Florida. I'm registered and ready for the 5-day pitch-fest, but I need funds to get there. In order to print on-site I need to take my set up from water-based ink to plastisol. Water-based ink doesn't allow for all-day printing as it will harden in the screen.

What I will need:

Single Color Manual Press: $172

1 Gallon of Emulsion: $60

1 Gallon of Ink: $45

Emulsion Scoop: $23

Flash Dryer: $400

Squeegees: $18

Cleaning Supplies: $85

Exposure Unit: $400

Marketing Materials: $100

Shirts/Totes/Textiles to Print On-Site for Event: $1,000

IndieGoGo Fees: $243.50

Total: $2546.50

The Perks!

Level 1 Contributors receive a custom designed sticker. 

Level 2 Contributors receive a sticker and hand-printed Thank You note with a hand-written note that I'll write to you from my booth at One Spark. 

Level 2.5 Contributors receive the sticker, Thank You note, an item already in the Zany Du inventory and your name on the "Wall of Supporters" on the back of the Zany Du Print Mobile!

Level 3 Contributors receive the sticker, Thank You note and the choice of a shirt/tote/print of the designated One Spark / Zany Du design and your name on the "Wall of Supporters" on the back of the Zany Du Print Mobile!

Level 4 Contributors receive the sticker, Thank You note, choice of shirt/tote/print of the designated One Spark / Zany Du designs and the choice to be the first to get the next Zany Du design on a shirt/tote/print or choose from previously printed items. Go ahead and raid the Etsy store! You'll also get your name on the "Wall of Supporters" on the back of the Zany Du Print Mobile!

Level 5 Contributors receive the sticker, Thank You note, choice of shirt/tote/print of the designated One Spark / Zany Du designs and the choice to be the first to get the next Zany Du design on a shirt/tote/print or choose from previously printed items and a one-on-one printing lesson for Jacksonville locals with your's truly! You'll also get your name on the "Wall of Supporters" on the back of the Zany Du Print Mobile!

Level 6 contributors receive the sticker, Thank You note, choice of shirt/tote/print of the designated One Spark / Zany Du designs and the choice to be the first to get the next Zany Du design on a shirt/tote/print or choose from previously printed items. In addition to the swag Jacksonville locals get the chance to be the first to host the Zany Du Print Mobile at your event! You just pay for shirts. Pretty nifty! You'll also get your name on the "Wall of Supporters" on the back of the Zany Du Print Mobile!

Risks and Challenges:

Without being able to showcase how unique and intriguing printing on-site is at One Spark I run the risk of finding investors and contributors who would be interested in the project.

Other Ways You Can Help:

- Help spread the word to friends and family who like to fund the arts, entrepreneurials, and go-getters! Simply use the IndieGoGo share tools!

-Volunteer at One Spark with me any time during the 5 days. Lunch is on me!

- Come see me at One Spark April 8-12!

- Be one of the first to book The Zany Du Print Mobile!

- If you're in the Jacksonville area and have any of the supplies or pieces of equipment I need please email Alexandra at zanydudesigns@gmail.com

story:
My Name is Juste A. GNIMAVO, I'm a Social and Futurist Entrepreneur. Founder of THALES BANK:

THE FIRST SOCIAL AND DIGITAL BANK EVER CREATED FOR AFRICA A BANK THAT WILL BELONG TO ITS OWN MEMBERS.

www.ThalesBank.com

MISSION STATEMENT: Develop the environment and individuals in the 55 nations of Africa is our main objective.


Why Will Thales Bank engage in Social Impact Activities?

  • There are nearly 1 billion hungry people in the world.
  • Nearly 21,000 children under the age of 5 died every day.
  • The highest rates of child mortality are in sub-Saharan Africa, where 1 in 8 children die before the age of 5 - a rate more than 17 times the average for developed regions.
  • More than 750 million people do not have sustainable access to safe drinking water.
  • another 2.5 billion lack access to improved sanitation facilities.


While mainstream banks are in most cases focused solely on the principle of profit maximization, THALES BANK will implement the triple principle of profit-people-planet.

THALES BANK will focus on investing in African communities, providing opportunities for the most disadvantaged, and supporting social, environmental, and ethical agendas. Our lending practices will produce a better quality of life for the greatest possible amount of people in Africa, and whose effects endure over time and continue to produce a multiplicity of positive effects long after the initial investment is made.

We will:

  • use the power of Internet and smartphones to develop new forms of banking that will be guided by solidarity, Transparency and responsibility in the 55 countries of Africa.
  • Enhance the life style of our own and future african generations.
  • Build solid relationships with our angel investors, members and  stakeholders that are based on reliability and commitment.
  • form a link between people who can invest money and people who need money to realize projects in Africa that have larger social impact and positive effects over time.
  • Get funds from social investors, members, stakeholders, take savings from socially conscious individuals and lend solely to social purpose organizations as projects for the unemployed.
  • Invest in  Social welfare, Agriculture, Education, Development AID, Health care… through the 55 countries of Africa.
  • innovated products and services with high demands will be launched to bring the African formal and informal sectors online and satisfy this target market during the next 20 years.


THALES BANK SERVICES:

 As An Ethical Digital Bank, aimed at alleviation of poverty and unemployment, to develop society, the environment and individuals in the 55 african countries, Thalès Bank will gradually launch :


  • The 1st loan and investment program for start-ups  in all 55 countries in Africa

African Business owners, Engineers, entrepreneurs, etc. have a great vision but they lack the funds to build it. They all need a source of financing to see their vision unfold. We will finance projects based on their social, environmental or cultural impact.

Whoever the project owner is, Wherever he lives in North, South, East or West Africa, Thales Bank will provide him the exact solution he's researching. We will offer a fast and inexpensive program to get financing. Million's of young africans will get job through this program. To reach our aim which is to develop AFRICA we will create  business plan from scratch based on any viable project oridea we will recieve.

Our experts will review, correct the deficiencies and enhance their Business plan, provide the required fund, team, training, coaching, management skills… they need to successfully launch their project through various funding souces.


  • Monetization of Bank instruments

99% of African entrepreneurs do not know about Bank instruments like Bank Guarantees (BG’s), Standby Letters of Credit (SBLC), Medium Term Notes (MTN’s), or other Bank instruments. Because they are issued by European banks mostly.Unlike traditional letter of credit, a bank instrument is where the beneficiary obtains payment against papers demonstrating delivery. The important part is that bank instrument leasing makes it possible to use a small amount of capital to attain a large amount of capital for a period of time.

We will develop relationships with some of the highest rated banks in the world to Monetize Bank Instruments for project owners (Worldwide). We can monetize just about any bank instrument to be used for project funding, move them into various trading platforms quickly and easily.


  •  Social Payment gateway

Thales Bank will provide the most advanced and comprehensive payment gateway  for eCommerce, mCommerce, MOTO, mPOS and POS. This brand new service will bring African merchants online and allow them to quit their classical selling methods and start now a profitable internet based business. They can now broaden their customer base on the international level. This product #1 is the key solution for the significant slump in sales many African merchants are unfortunately observing now.


  • The first prepaid visa card available in the 55 countries of Africa

We will design and market a brand new PREPAID VISA CARD that consumers or anyone in Africa can get and use online and pay merchants products and services everywhere in Africa or reload their friend or family member card to satisfy an urgent need. Thales Bank aims to bridge the barriers grown between africans with new technologies to simplify interaction.


  • Person-to-person (P2P) payments in all 55 countries of Africa

For many consumers, using cash or checks has been the easiest way to pay a friend or acquaintance. However, with more and more consumers making retail purchases and managing finances via smartphones or other electronic devices, the time is right to introduce a new way of sending money that’s fast, convenient and safe:

- Convenient and simple way to send and receive money

- Instant transfer and immediate fund withdrawal

- works on any mobile device brand and via any telecom operator

 The new horizon for today’s digitally demanding, fast-moving consumers is paying any person, company or institution – quickly, securely and easily. With acomputer or mobile phone. The money goes straight from one account to another.

Through our SOCIAL DIGITAL BANK Anyone  in Africa will be able now to:

  • Send cash to a friend or a family member anywhere in Africa
  • Pay utility bills or school fees for a friend living in a remote area anywhere in Africa
  • Pay with an email address or a mobile number anywhere in Africa
  • Pay treatment fees for anyone with 2 clicks of a mouse or the tap of an app.
  • Reimburse a friend
  • Pay a taxi fare or a restaurant bill
  • Make a rent payment to a landlord, etc.

 

WHY SHOULD I JOIN THALES BANK ?

JOIN US NOW AND BECOME A CO-OWNER

At Thales Bank, Transparency and Solidarity are our main objectives.Thales Bank will belong to its members aimed to provide full ethical accounts to all their members of how their money is lent where money has gone and what its doing.

This means that you not only earn interest but you will also know exactly what your money "does" while at the bank. We will develop a number of tools  will make this as transparent as possible. You can easily Track the impact your investments have on the African greater community. Your money is 100 percent safe and fully protected.We are going  to create "through the power of Internet" a community of stakeholders savers, borrowers, angel investors, staff and board members who will share our common vision and mission: Develop Africa


THALES BANK..., "Know where your money goes"

story:
Are you vegan? So are we. Myself, my husband and our daughter, became vegan about five years ago. Henry has been in business for himself for more than 20 years. I have been helping him for the past nine years, In addition,  I also have experience in healthcare and teaching.

Like many other's our journey to veganism started with a health crisis. Henry became very ill and we changed our eating habits, to fight his illness. Now, 5 years later, we are ethical vegans. It's all about the animals.

The problem that we met was finding vegan foods that were familiar to us. Especially in places like fairs, festivals, and even the farmers' markets. Cost was another problem, it seemed like all vegan food was twice the price.

Our family has set out on a mission to solve those problems. By bringing familiar and affordable vegan hot dogs to the public that will appeal to vegans and non-vegans.

When you give to our campaign, you're helping the animals, helping other vegans, and you're helping to encourage more plant-based eating.

Bottom line, the more vegan food on the streets, the better. And YES, non-vegans do buy vegan food when it is available.

What will we use the money for?

$2000-to build the cart

$1000- for various governmental fees

$500-for insurance

$500-for a website

$1000-for supplies and food to open the cart with.

story:
CLOSED - all tickets to now be bought from www.billetto.co.uk/the-uk-vegan-campout
 

The UK's first vegan camping festival!

The UK vegan movement is unstoppable, so isn't it time we had a proper summer outdoor festival? Inspiring speakers, live music, entertainment, and delicious vegan food.

We had an amazing time organising the first UK Vegan Camp-out in Derby. It went better than any of us could have imagined, and with so much positive feedback and suggestions for next year, how could we not do it again?

Now we want to go even BIGGER...

  • MORE beautiful people - 2,500, up from 400 at the first camp. That means a...
  • NEW venue - the 18-acre National Water Sports Centre in Nottingham
  • INSPIRING speakers and vegan personalities
  • ACTIVISM workshops giving you the chance to work with respected activists
  • Two STAGES - one main stage tent and a smaller workshop marquee
  • LIVE music and dancing in the main tent
  • FOOOOOD - Unless Hardcore Vegan Catering, Mex It Up, cakes and more
  • FAMILY vibes - kid's play area, family camping area and nature trail

...but we're going to need YOUR help

There's a good reason why nothing like this has ever been attempted successfully before. Costs. We're flying in speakers from Australia, Germany, Canada and the US; hiring staff and stage crew to keep everything moving along nicely and everyone safe; insurance for peace-of-mind; marketing so everyone knows about it; t-shirts to design so you have something to take home; and not to mention the cost of hiring the campsite.

Wait, aren't we selling tickets?

Yes, but because our ticketing partner has refunds to consider - unlikely as that will be - we won't get those funds until after the event - too late to cover many of the costs.

So short of taking out a massive loan and giving the banks their interest, or pandering to profit-hungry investors, we're turning to you, the vegan community, for help.

Where will your pledges go?

  • Flights and fees for international speakers
  • Live music
  • Entertainers
  • Campsite hire
  • Electricity
  • Marquee and stage hire
  • AV equipment hire
  • Staffing and security
  • Stage crew costs
  • Public liability insurance
  • Camp signage
  • Marketing

What you'll get in return

Isn't an awesome two-night vegan festival enough? No?! Ok then! 

The £25 BASIC perk gives entry to one adult - essentially the same as buying a ticket except it's non-refundable - you're basically helping us with a £25 donation that gives a perk in return.

The £40 ADVANCED perk includes entry plus an awesome Vegan Camp-out t-shirt, which our designer is busy working on right now. The £50 PRO perk is much the same, but with an extra bit of dosh because you love us and want to make our lives that little bit easier. All other perks after that give additional tickets.

The show will go on...

If we don't reach our goal, the camp will still go ahead, but we may have to scale back quite a lot and that would be a huge shame. So let's not let that happen.

Your pledge will go towards creating something amazing, and raising the bar for all future vegan events in the UK.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't offer a contribution, don't worry, any help is greatly appreciated.

  • Share this on Facebook, Twitter, get the word out and make some noise about the Vegan Camp-out.
  • Tell any vegans you know who might be interested in a summer knees-up
  • And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Visit VeganCampout.co.uk

story:
About

 

I am obsessed with good tacos. I was born and raised in San Antonio, Texas so I pretty much had no say in the matter. After traveling the country and a little of the world, thanks to my 10 years in the Navy, I decided to head off to culinary school. I graduated from the Culinary Institute of American in Hyde Park, NY. and worked in some amazing restaurants across the country. I decided it was time to move back to Panama City and bring some of those great flavors I had discovered back to the emerald coast. Juan Taco is the culmination of my travels, studies and my philosophy of what a cool little taco shop could be. With your help we can make Juan Taco a reality. Thank you for you amazing support.

 

Short Summary

Juan Taco is a modern taco restaurant for people who are tired of the same old Mexican food being offered everywhere today. I am truly passionate about great food & drinks made from scratch using simple recipes and wholesome ingredients. 

Juan Martinez is the driving forces behind Juan Taco. I am a veteran of the restaurant industry and truly believe in creating an energetic and fun atmosphere where everyone is free to relax and enjoy life one beer or margarita at a time.

I believe that i am not alone in my desire to see better dining options available here in our local community. I’m using my Indeigogo campaign to help fund my first location so that I can bring these awesome tacos and amazing margaritas to everyone in Panama City. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am hoping to raise $5,000 in our 30 day campaign. It's going to be tough, but I believe in you.  All of the profits from the campaign will go to help cover the cost of my first location.  Funds will cover equipment, renovations, and of course tables and chairs so that you have somewhere to sit and enjoy these awesome tacos and delicious home made margaritas. 

I’m planning on opening my first location right here in Panama City, FL. I have plans and permits filled out as well as a detailed game plan ready for when I find the perfect location. 

Because you're awesome and have decided to donate to my cause, I’m going to reward you with some pretty awesome Juan Taco perks. If you just want to donate and you don't want swag, you can click the "back it" button on the right side of the screen. To claim a perk, click on the perk!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Noosa

Our Vision: to build and grow a restaurant group that is independently owned by our chefs. We believe in giving passionate individuals opportunities to grow and flourish while at the same time growing our restaurant community with exciting, sustainable & creative experiences. 

  • Our Noosa team has 70 (!) years of combined restaurant experience, including restaurants in Erie (1201 Kitchen, since 2008) and Westfield (Bird 2016). Our management team consists of Dan Kern (chef, director of food) J.b Innes (FOH manager) Mike Karle (chef) & Adam Williams (chef)
  • We have an amazing opportunity to create a new restaurant at the Northeast Marina & help grow our independently owned business! Erie county's ONLY lakeside restaurant with the most amazing panoramic view of the sunsets over Lake Erie! Docking services will be available (sail or boat to dinner!) and we are in the heart of wine country! Our beer, wine & spirits program will consist only of Pennsylvania made products! 
  • Your help is so important! We have a vision and need your help to achieve it! We are pouring our entire pool of resources into the restaurant to remodel the kitchen & dining room! This includes wall and floor surfaces, lighting, tables, chairs & equipment! Your financial contributions will help us with achieving this along with all of the other costs in opening a restaurant (inventory, licensing, training, etc.)

You are supporting a local business that will be supporting local businesses. We love Erie and want to see it thrive! Here's our chance!!

What We Need & What You Get

  • After reviewing our proposed budget and offering every available resource from restaurant's partners, we need to raise $25,000 to bring our vision to life
  • We have some amazing perks available to those who are generous enough to help us, including VIP Champagne Parties, Tasting Menus and gift cards to our other restaurants!
  • If we don't reach our total goal we will be putting all of the funds that we have (yours & ours) towards the biggest priorities that Noosa faces, and we will be forced to build in small stages.

The Impact

  • You are helping build our area's restaurant community, employing hard working locals with families and a business that supports other local businesses.
  • We have successfully started, built & operated 1201 Kitchen  & Bird for a combined 11 years.
  • We believe in handmade, quality products. We believe Erie can be the place everyone thinks it can be. We accept the challenge and work required to make our home a better place!

Risks & Challenges

We will be taking possession of the property on January 1st and hope to be open by April 1st. A four month turnaround for completely remodeling a restaurant while changing the current managerial structure of our restaurant group and running our current operations will be our biggest challenge. Oh, and Chef Dan is expecting his first child (a baby girl!) in the middle of it all! 

  • With over 70 years of combined restaurant experience, we are confident that we are fit for this project!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make some noise! If you have ever eaten at 1201, Bird or know anyone involved in this project then you know how passionate we are about restaurants & food! Share this on Facebook or Twitter and tell as many people as you know to help us out!
  • Indiegogo has some easy, great share tools to help get our campaign out there!

With love from our team,
          Thank you for all your support over the past 11 years, you allow us to do what we love and we are forever thankful. We hope to be around for a long, long time.
               Cheers- Dan Kern, Jb Innes, Mike Karle & Adam Williams

Our Vision: to build and grow a restaurant group that is independently owned by our chefs. We believe in giving passionate individuals opportunities to grow and flourish while at the same time growing our restaurant community with exciting, sustainable & creative experiences. 

Our Noosa team has 70 (!) years of combined restaurant experience, including restaurants in Erie (1201 Kitchen, since 2008) and Westfield (Bird 2016). Our management team consists of Dan Kern (chef, director of food) J.b Innes (FOH manager) Mike Karle (chef) & Adam Williams (chef)
We have an amazing opportunity to create a new restaurant at the Northeast Marina & help grow our independently owned business! Erie county's ONLY lakeside restaurant with the most amazing panoramic view of the sunsets over Lake Erie! Docking services will be available (sail or boat to dinner!) and we are in the heart of wine country! Our beer, wine & spirits program will consist only of Pennsylvania made products! 
Your help is so important! We have a vision and need your help to achieve it! We are pouring our entire pool of resources into the restaurant to remodel the kitchen & dining room! This includes wall and floor surfaces, lighting, tables, chairs & equipment! Your financial contributions will help us with achieving this along with all of the other costs in opening a restaurant (inventory, licensing, training, etc.)

You are supporting a local business that will be supporting local businesses. We love Erie and want to see it thrive! Here's our chance!!

What We Need & What You Get

After reviewing our proposed budget and offering every available resource from restaurant's partners, we need to raise $25,000 to bring our vision to life
We have some amazing perks available to those who are generous enough to help us, including VIP Champagne Parties, Tasting Menus and gift cards to our other restaurants!
If we don't reach our total goal we will be putting all of the funds that we have (yours & ours) towards the biggest priorities that Noosa faces, and we will be forced to build in small stages.


The Impact

You are helping build our area's restaurant community, employing hard working locals with families and a business that supports other local businesses.
We have successfully started, built & operated 1201 Kitchen  & Bird for a combined 11 years.
We believe in handmade, quality products. We believe Erie can be the place everyone thinks it can be. We accept the challenge and work required to make our home a better place!


Risks & Challenges
We will be taking possession of the property on January 1st and hope to be open by April 1st. A four month turnaround for completely remodeling a restaurant while changing the current managerial structure of our restaurant group and running our current operations will be our biggest challenge. Oh, and Chef Dan is expecting his first child (a baby girl!) in the middle of it all! 
With over 70 years of combined restaurant experience, we are confident that we are fit for this project!

Other Ways You Can Help

Make some noise! If you have ever eaten at 1201, Bird or know anyone involved in this project then you know how passionate we are about restaurants & food! Share this on Facebook or Twitter and tell as many people as you know to help us out!
Indiegogo has some easy, great share tools to help get our campaign out there!

With love from our team,          Thank you for all your support over the past 11 years, you allow us to do what we love and we are forever thankful. We hope to be around for a long, long time.               Cheers- Dan Kern, Jb Innes, Mike Karle & Adam Williams

story:
INTRO

My name is Osama, I’m twenty six years old and I’m a junior programmer, formerly a maintenance engineer. Outside working hours, my mum and I make and sell nut butters under the name “Peanut Better” to provide my family with a stable income. The varieties we make are peanut butter, almond butter, cashew butter and pistachio butter. Our products are additive-free, which means they don’t contain salt, sugar, corn syrup, oils, hydrogenated fats or even honey! Our products are healthy, delicious and versatile. They’re vegan-friendly, too!

The reasons why I started this small business were, firstly, to provide Jordan with healthy, nutritional alternatives in nut butters at an affordable price. The Jordanian breakfast table is filled with unhealthy and needlessly expensive products by multinational corporations in the modern day, and I am trying to provide a better, grassroots, and homemade alternative for both nutritional and economic benefit. Moreover, this project is now my family’s main source of income after it had lost its former one, and I thus see it as a synergy of benefiting my community while keeping my family stable and provided for.

As I pursued Peanut Better, it became the first business of its kind in Jordan to specialize in producing different varieties of all natural, additive-free nut butters.

 

HOW I GOT THE IDEA

While living in Sweden, I encountered the simplistic wonder of natural peanut butter. It contained no sugar, palm oil, vegetable oil, corn syrup or any kinds of hydrogenated fats. It was so different from what’s predominantly available on the market, in terms of texture and taste. It was far superior and I simply got addicted!

When I came back to Jordan, finding natural peanut butter wasn’t easy, mainly due to its high price, inconsistent availability and the fact that most brands still add some extra ingredients. Thus, I decided to make my own, and that’s where it all began. Several attempts later, we managed to achieve the desired texture and taste and even apply it to almonds and cashews!

 

WHY I STARTED PEANUT BETTER AND WHAT WE’VE ACHIEVED SO FAR

I often entertained the thought of turning this idea into a small business, but I never really considered it, because I was focused on starting a programming career. However, things never go as well as we hope.

2016 started out rough, mainly because my family lost its main source of income. Eventually, it came to a point where I was left no choice but to figure something out to cope with the situation at hand. And so, my mum and I started Peanut Better with little to no resources in late September 2016. A dream to give to my community fused itself with a need to maintain my family’s survival, giving birth to this project.

Over the past six months, I had to learn how to promote our products with little to no cost, by utilizing social media and attending local markets whenever available. Luckily, we’ve managed to reach out to larger parts of the community. We’ve been receiving positive feedback and favorable reviews. Seeing how our customers are happy with the products and keep coming back for more has always felt rewarding and given us motivation to constantly improve and push forward! Your support would thus ensure that we keep our customers’ satisfaction, and not go out of business due to the increasing costs imposed by demand, governmental fees, and such matters.

 

WHY I STARTED THIS CAMPAIGN

The trends have been positive so far. However, the lack of resources remains a huge obstacle that prevents us from growing and making enough products to match the increasing demand. The equipment we’re currently using has a very low production capacity and is highly prone to damage, considering the amounts we’re producing. Unfortunately, and no matter how I slice it, saving up for new equipment isn’t a possibility, considering my family’s economic needs.

Therefore, I decided to start this campaign, hoping to reach out to a larger community and get the help I need.

Please bear in mind that, while I take pride in and enjoy doing this small business, I have no intention of using it for personal financial gain. Ultimately, this is meant to provide a safety net for my mother and siblings, and is barely sufficient to keep the project going. In addition, any further success of this program is eventually delivered to the hands of my mother, in order to give her an autonomous, independent source of income without her need to rely on any others.

Enabling me to make this happen would mean the world to me and my mother. It would also help us improve quality and keep making nut butters the best way possible. As a humble token of gratitude, you’ll receive a jar of peanut butter as soon as we’ve made it through this. If you’re not in Jordan, please consider visiting some time. I would love to meet and thank you in person. And give you a jar of peanut butter!

To sum up, I’m starting this fundraiser, because we’re in need for an initial investment to upgrade our equipment and secure proper working capital. This is all vital in order to be able to produce and deliver our products consistently and sustainably.

Reaching the campaign goal means a better chance for the business to grow and succeed. Your help is highly appreciated!

Thank you for reading. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.

-Osama

+962 79 629 64 50

oajlouni1990@gmail.com

story:
Dash Training Facility

Dash Training Facility is a new sports performance gym located in Livermore, California. This gym is geared towards the peak performance of serious athletes. We are different than any other sports performance gym because we cover all aspects of performance. The three aspects of performance are physical ability, mental strength and recovery. The most advanced athletic training methods in the industry will be applied to achieve top physical ability. Meditation, sensory deprivation and neurofeedback, practiced by professional and Olympic athletes, will be the main techniques used for our athletes to increase mental strength. After an intense workout or long season, compression massage and cryotherapy will be provided to ensure recovery. While every other sports performance facility focuses solely on improving physical ability, the Dash experience will be a one stop shop for serious and dedicated athletes to reach their full potential.

We will be the only sports performance gym to offer memberships for complete access to our weight lifting equipment and thirty yards of turf.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $15,000 through this campaign to start us on our journey to opening this gym. 

The money raised will go towards gym equipment, a cryotherapy machine, neurofeedback equipment and capital.

You will receive perks that include a DTF tank top or T-shirt, cryotherapy or float tank sessions and different packages of personal training when the gym opens. You don't have to be an athlete to train here! Your personal training sessions will be tailored to your specific goals.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand if you cannot afford to donate, but you can still help us out! 

You can share this campaign with everyone on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and LinkedIn.

story:
Food Before Love, a community for food lovers everywhere to connect, discover and share amazing food experiences together.

Since 2012, we've grown from reviewing restaurants locally to internationally. We’ve also evolved into a platform that curates food-centric events and trips around the world. Food Before Love was created to give food lovers everywhere a platform to tell their own stories through living and dining across cities and cultures while creating these experiences on their own terms.

We’ve received tons of support servicing over 2500 attendees, and made great strides in providing a unique space for the under-served foodie. We have held over 100 events in the past 5 years through partnerships, sponsorships and our signature events like Mimosaholic Brunch Series, Mac Madness, The Natural Hair Brunch Affair and even traveling with a group to Cartagena, Colombia -- just to name a few!

Food Before Love has come to be synonymous with acceptance and visibility. It is a huge part of what makes the brand what it is, and why I’m asking for your help to expand. In order to create our very first food festival next year, the business needs the support of a team to scale.

Working as a solo entrepreneur gets things done, but only a dedicated team can take it to the next level.

We have so many ideas in the pipeline that our community needs and we know we can execute at a higher level with more support.

An increase in our financial capital will give us a head start on bringing bigger, more unique and inclusive experiences to our growing list of supporters, starting with our food festival. Your contribution will directly support crucial positions we’re adding to the Food Before Love brand. We’ll be bringing food-loving writers, an editor, and creative managers on board to help provide more for my fellow food lovers, and allow us to execute on those ideas we have in store for you.

5 years ago, I knew that people like me needed a great food experience every chance they could get. That love is what drove me to create the digital platform that is Food Before Love today. It’s become a combination of my first love and my passion.

I’m extremely proud to have created Food Before Love. It’s an amazing feeling to know that I’m solving a real problem that real people have. It’s even more amazing to know I have the support of others to take Food Before Love to unimaginable heights.

 

If you’ve ever enjoyed a meal with us, we can’t thank you enough, and we would've never been able to get this far without you! Thank you so much to everyone for taking the time to hear our story!

We hope to eat with you soon!

story:
My name is Vic Pellegrini: creator and owner operator of Bullseye Virtual Combat. 5 years ago I had a vision for a more advanced, realistic version of the Lasertag game I grew up with. Countless hours over many days, weeks and months were spent planning, constructing and testing until approximately 3 years ago when my vision became a reality. Now, we are New Jersey’s first Tactical Lasertag, running video game style missions on an ever expanding field while tracking EVERY SINGLE shot you take. Returning players even have the ability to earn special accommodations and rewards as the rank up on our online leaderboards.

My vow to every one of my customers is to absolutely, hands down, blow you away with all that we have to offer, and provide you with enough variety to keep you coming back time and time again!

This campaign was created because it's time for us to go bigger! I want to provide my customers a more epic battle experience THIS season. We started out small to prove the concept, and we have experienced a lot of growth in 3 years. We have more guns, more grenades and more in game extras, but we can do so much more! Right now, our capabilities are to have 12 players at any given time on the field. 12 is fun, but more would be even better! We have nearly unlimited space to expand our field, and are currently only limited by the amount of equipment we have available. Our state of the art system can handle 10x that many players at once and we can customize missions to create just about any battle scenario we can come up with. 

Imagine:

3 teams of 10 all trying to capture one center objective

3 teams of 10 now defending their own objective while still trying to capture the others.

Epic Zombie Battles. 

You and your squad vs a zombie horde, and the player (or zombie) with the most points wins! 

The possibilities are literally endless.

Your contributions can help us ramp up much quicker than we might otherwise be able to. We are on the verge of something extraordinary, and would love your support in getting there.

In the News!

Verizon Fios News Video

Rutgers Daily Targum

Patch News Zombie Article

MyCentralJersey and Courier News

What We Need & What You Get

We will be open for business in April 2018 no matter what. We are fully funded, insured and equipped to handle our current customers just like in 2017. The purpose of this campaign, however, is so we can acquire the additional gear we need to make our Bullseye experience even better.

 

Our equipment is all purchased through Icombat, which is based out of Whitewater, Wisconsin. It is some of the most expensive lasertag technology on the market, but there is a reason we have chosen this equipment. With ultra-realistic look and feel, all of our gear is integrated into a top of the line software system that also records and tracks everything online. Since you get what you pay for, we feel it is well worth it. We purchase each set in doubles so teams are always even, and we also plan to buy extra headbands for our zombie modes.  

 

Aside from all the additional gameplay options you will enjoy, you may be wondering what is in it for you for supporting Bullseye Virtual Combat. The incentives we are offering are by far the best deals we will offer for the year. Not only are we offering tremendous value, but flexibility as well….since we are allowing you to use your tickets ANY WEEKEND with ZERO limitations. You can sign up online and lock in your whole squad, or just find a session with players signed up and join in. Our deals are normally reserved to single days or weekends, so get this while it lasts.

 

The Impact

We have been growing as a company since our first field in 2016. We have listened to our customers suggestions, and incorporated many of them. Our primary focus is and always will be to provide the absolute best customer service, the best battles and a one of a kind experience that you can’t get anywhere else….to keep our customers coming back time and time again.

Risks & Challenges

Most crowdfunding campaigns are promising a future products or idea, but we are already in business and launching in April.  There is no risk in purchasing a ticket since we are running every weekend from April-November.  We also allow rescheduling due to weather when applicable.

Other Ways You Can Help

So, you don’t live close enough to play at our current location? You can still make a difference by sharing this campaign with your social network. We know that there are fundraising groups, sports teams and corporate events out there looking for the newest and best team building event around…..and we have it.

 

FAQs

What if I don't play video games?
That's no problem. Our games are easy to understand and the only advantage of being a gamer is familiarity with our game modes.  Tips and tricks for the specific field and game mode are explained before every match.  There will always be a Bullseye Captain with your and your team.

Are the lasers safe?
Yes. We use infrared LEDs (similar to those in a TV remote) and infrared lasers, all powered below eye-safe levels.

What age do I need to be to play?
Anyone under 18 will require a legal guardian to sign their waiver. In order to play a public game you must be 13+. During a private booking anyone who can physically hold up the guns can play with a  legal guardian. This age restriction is to provide a safe game for all players of varying age.

Does my ticket expire? Are there refunds?
These tickets are good for the 2018 season.  We will make all efforts to accomodate rescheduling due to weather and you can reschedule private books up to 48 hours in advance.

What if you don't meet your goal? Will my game ticket still be honoured?
Absolutely. We’re excited to reach our goal to purchase to software, supplies and most importantly more equipment.  We are currently able to handles 12 players on the field at one time and will be open from April-November 2018.  The playing field will be opened regardless of the outcome of the campaign.

Can I book a company outing?
Absolutely! Our Corporate bookings are perfect for a company outing and if you have a special request let us know and we will see if we can accommodate you!

Can I book a birthday party?

Of course!  We pride ourselves on our ability to run a fun and exciting birthday party.  We have been open for 2 seasons and have already had multiple return birthday parties.

Of course!  We pride ourselves on our ability to run a fun and exciting birthday party.  We have been open for 2 seasons and have already had multiple return birthday parties.

story:
ABOUT US

Caldos de Corazón is a small food business that provides a monthly rotation hearty soup meals of international variety that are ready-to-go for the busy student or professional. We started during a turbulent time of earthquakes and other tribulations beyond our control, but despite it, the market reception to innovative concepts rings strong in Cholula, Mexico.

The idea came from Jonathan, a dancer and marketer by profession, who after living in New York City for a year sought cosmopolitan ideas found in one of the major urban heartbeats of the world. After 2 contracts saving money working on the Disney Dream cruise ship, he came back to Mexico and joined forces with Juanelo.

 

Juanelo, though an electrical engineer by trade, worked for a family business that catered to the national oil giant, PEMEX and worked with several startups. His franchise knowledge and operational know-how keeps the business running and is currently laying the groundwork for our procedures and legal steps that will contribute to our franchise eligibility in the upcoming years.

We want to create an eco-friendly food option that is accessible and also satisfies the internationally diverse palates of the Puebla market.

What Your Contribution Will Go Towards

We all know opening a food service business is both rough and pricey, so here is a breakdown of what your contributions will go towards:

  • Decorating/furnishing our new store front location (already picked out!)
  • The first quarter of operating costs (roughest one!)
  • The purchase of new/refurbished/second-hand equipment custom made to store and serve soups.
  • Cost of any renovations or modifications to new space.
  • Decor, new business sign and marketing costs from third-party firm (wary that a solid company image needs to hire a solid marketing firm!)

The Impact

  • Reinvesting into the talented pool that is found in the university cities of Puebla and Cholula.
  • Ecologically friendly. We have a no-styrofoam policy and waste is minimal.
  • Anything unsold and leftover will go to disenfranchised communities in affiliation with local churches and their mission endeavors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Nowadays, economic times are rough (take it from us!); however, we know that not everyone is able to make a monetary contribution...

BUT...

You can get our message out there to help us raise funds. Even that would be immensely helpful, and we'd appreciate it so much! Be sure to use the IndieGogo tools for sharing to get word out.

Thank you for taking time to read through this and watch the video we painstakingly made! Please feel free to drop us a line on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Caldosdecorazon or DM us via Instagram @caldosdecorazon.

ESPAÑOL: Para mayor información en español, contáctanos en nuestras redes!

Warmest soupy wishes,

Your Friends - J&J

story:
For a couple of years I’ve been roasting coffee for friends and family. I can’t keep up with demand from friends and so want to purchase a small commercial roaster. There is a significant jump in capacity from home roasters to commercial roasters, and so in addition to supplying my friends and family, I am also seeking Crafers West neighbours who are interested in supply.

I'm currently roasting a Colombian Supremo which produces a bold, slightly spicy espresso that stands-up well in milk based drinks. Coffee roasted just a couple of days ago simply can’t be purchased at the supermarket, and is even hard to find in specialty coffee shops.

At this stage I can provide whole beans (not pre ground) for the purists who grind their coffee fresh before every cup.  As well as the Colombian bean I’m currently roasting, there are a couple of other high-end single origin beans that I’ve had great success with.

I need to establish about 10 neighbours who want ongoing supply. What I can offer is specialty single origin coffee to your door within days / hours of it being roasted. 

I have created an offer on this website of a one-off 250g purchase for people who just want to try the beans before any further commitment. In addition to that offer are a limited number of 3 x 250g and 3 x 500g offers. 

Thanks,

Nick

story:
HELP CREATE ANOTHER WEEDMOBILE

Edward Forchion, aka the NJ Weedman, has got brass cojones. He has been single-handedly storming the barricades of prohibition for years as a cannabis activist. Since the 90's he's been very outspoken in favor of legalization. He goes way back with Gov. Chris Christie. Now Ed has set up a cannabis temple called The Liberty Bell Temple III in the heart of a prohibitionist state government in Trenton, NJ, right across the street from City Hall and down the block from the Federal courthouse.

The NJWeedman is demanding his religious right to use cannabis. ( SEE VICE NEWS STORY ).

Of course the police raided him, and seized all the video footage that would exonerate him but what hurt the most he says is: THE TRENTON NJ POLICE; seized his WEEDMOBILE and crushed it.

Ed is no-longer a dealer, but his cannabis temple is a sanctuary for young musicians and artists to escape the violence of Trenton. The Liberty Bell Temple III is also the only place you can go on the east coast and publicly burn all the ganja you want. It is unique.

In an era of Black Lives Matter, where people are afraid of being shot by the police, The NJWeedman is openly making a stand, loudly shouting "FUCK THE LAW, SMOKE IT ANYWAY!" to the man, and declaring that the law is wrong, not him and that cannabis is good. He used his WEEDMOBILE to advertise his TEMPLE, like a church uses a church van to advertise a church, but this irritated the TRENTON POLICE DEPARTMENT. 

 His “Weedmobile” was destroyed.

THE WEEDMOBILE was a 1986 Ford E-150 that featured a colorful, controversial portrait of NJWeedmans blowing smoke into Uncle Sam’s face. Forchion used the van as an advertisement for his restaurant and ‘cannabis temple’ and as a protest against New Jersey marijuana laws that he calls ‘hypocritical’.

Trenton police called Forchion’s weedmobile an “irritant”, and it was reduced to a hunk of metal after NJWeedman got into a pissing contest with Trenton Police Captain Gonzales over hours of operation. ( #nochickenwingsafter11pm ) 

READ https://www.merryjane.com/culture/edward-forchion-nj-weedman-police-harassment

 

      HELP CREATE ANOTHER WEEDMOBILE

DONATE TO THE WEEDMOBILE FUND

GOAL 7,500.oo

Edward Forchion believes he can acquire a 1980's style custom van for about $3,000 and has spoken with a company that does vehicle wraps that say they can redo the art in wrap for about $3,000. With miscellaneous items like RIMS, RADIO and a PA speaker system for an additional $1,500.oo. THE WEEDMOBILE COULD RAISE AGAIN FOR $7,500.

 

https://www.paypal.me/THEWEEDMOBILE​

 

-

PS -- THE POLICE ALSO STOLE OUR DELIVERY VEHICLE

SEE: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K7IPZ2jTY_g

story:
My dream and me.

My dream is to set up an affordable doggy spa in Wrexham, North Wales. With top of the range equipment, training in holistic methods and kinder methods of grooming, a bright and friendly atmosphere and above all a relaxing, fun experience for all types and breeds of dogs.

I have owned dogs all my life, and after a bout of severe depression left me unable to work, I moved into grooming friends dogs. Many of them came to me with tales of cage dryers, itching after shampoo's and a stressful experience for the dog. After seeing some close friends work in an amazingly professional, yet calm and gentle manner I was moved to set up a salon like no other in my area - A holistic dog spa dedicated to affordable, but fun and relaxing, treatments for our beloved pets!

Having my own salon has allowed me time to dedicate to another passion of mine - helping rescue dogs find their forever homes! Offering a free groom to rescue centres helps immensely,  giving the dogs the makeover that can often make a huge difference. 

Andy the Rescue.

 

Holistic grooming – What is it all about?

Holistic grooming is the practice of grooming your pet in a stress-free environment in order to provide optimal health for both body and mind.

Dogs and cats are extremely intuitive to our emotions. They pick up the chemicals we excrete from our bodies created from our own emotions. They know when we exhibit stresses because of anger, frustration or feeling rushed. As a result of their pack mentality, a dog interprets these stresses as “unbalanced” and they begin to lose confidence and trust in their surroundings and their pack, because of this I am hoping to design a calm and peaceful experience for both the owner and the dog

Many larger salons have an “assembly line” model that requires you to drop off early and pick up 6-8 hours later. The purpose is to allow bathers to pre-wash your pet and place in cage dryers for long periods of time until the dog is dry. This “hands-off” procedure allows the groomers to knock off more dogs, creating a more profitable business, and more stressful dogs!. In my holistic salon I take in one dog at a time, with the professional groomer working hands-on from bath to drying to haircut in a much more personal manner. This way any of the pets needs can be attended to completely.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is equipment!
It's not cheap setting up an exclusive doggy spa and I aim to offer top of the range treatments for pets, whilst keeping costs as low as possible to pass onto the owners.

£1450 -  The Jacuzzi Spa Bath.
This is an innovative new product dedicated to the growing trend of relaxation therapy for pets. The bath features massage bubble jet technology, releasing thousands of bubbles per minute to relax joints and muscles for an immediate sensation of well-being. The bath also has a warm water function to increase circulation Offers effective, soothing hydrotherapy, ideal for mature or arthritic dogs, or those suffering with stiffness from injuries or accidents.

£700 - The Aeolus Lo Lo table.
This grooming table adjusts to one of the lowest points on the market, enabling step on access for mature or less mobile animals. Simply step the dog onto the table, and raise up electrically to a working height. Stops the need for lifting animals onto tables, causing distress to them and back pain for the groomer.

£850 - Neptune Electric bath - Same as the table, the bath is adjustable, allowing larger breeds, and dogs with movement difficulties a much easier way of accessing the bath. At a larger depth, this bath is ideal for larger breeds as well as small. 

£500 - Salon Interior Improvements! Colours are extremely important. Dogs view them different to us, but because WE are relaxed, our dogs are often relaxed. I have a bright space allowing natural light, and to make the most of this with bright, calming colours. Greens, browns and natural colours will set up a peaceful feeling to the salon.

£200 - Shampoos, balms, facials and other grooming products. The most costly expense to a grooming salon is the products used. Holistic grooming understands that high-quality products are essential for a healthy skin and coat and will not compromise health for cost. I will be hoping to use WildWash products in my salon, top of the range, natural products from UK sellers.

story:
The Nowear Compound

Nowear is an American made company that focuses on growing the sport of bicycle freestyle in positive ways.  We offer American made goods and put on professional BMX stunt shows. 

Our biggest passion is helping today's youth and working with troubled kids.  We are able to do this through our six acre BMX training facility located in Nebraska called "The Nowear Compound."  It's 100% free to all riders, our only requirements are to wear a helmet and bring a smile!

     

Currently there are not any indoor skateparks in our state that allow bicycles, the only building kids can go to when it rains or snows is a 110 year old barn on our grounds.  It is extremely small and doesn't protect our riders from the cold and harsh Midwest winters. 

A New Building!

A new building would allow us to provide this for the riders who cannot afford to travel hundreds of miles to the surrounding states that already have this type of facility.  Currently there are facilities offered year round in the United States, with gymnastics-style equipment for not only learning the big tricks, but learning tricks safely.  Not all families can travel such distances, let alone afford some of the high costs of just attending them.

Sports are a HUGE part of our lives that help with character development and play a big role in determining the type of person we become.  Team sports provide this for a lot of kids, but not every kid is cut out for them.  We are offering this opportunity to kids by being a part of a positive group of riders, through an individual sport.  The environment we are providing at the Nowear Compound allows for kids who have maybe had some trouble in their lives have a place where they can come and have a positive experience that impacts them.  Nowear, along with the help of some good friends and local businesses have given hundreds of riders a home away from home with the Compound.  For a large part of the year we are able to provide a safe environment for kids and families to come together and enjoy the sport of BMX.  An indoor facility would make this possible year round, and the right equipment would make it even safer.

 

We Need Your Help!

Our goal is to raise $50,000 to put up the building that will house the bike park.  This would pay for the materials for the structure, heating and lighting.  We are putting in the labor ourselves so that we can make this happen.  We have connections in the building industry that support our cause that are willing to help keep labor costs down. 

We are offering several perks so you can show off your support for our cause!  From bumper stickers to T-shirts to even naming the building!

  • All donations of $50 and above will receive an invitation to the Grand Opening Pre-Party!
  • All donations of $500 and above will receive a shout out in the 2017 Nowear Thank You Video - A rider will dedicate a trick to you or your business!
  • All donations of $2,500 and above will have their logo displayed on our company trailer!

The Impact

The impact of Nowear to Ride goes beyond just a training facility.  

  • Our project is valuable to the community because we can provide a safe environment for BMX riders of all ages where the young and seasoned can support and help each other.
  • Nowear was a 2015 FEDEX Small Business Grant Winner.  We won $5,000 that we were able to put towards expanding our outdoor ramp. 
  • In 2014, 2015 and 2016 Nowear put on a Midwest Backyard Contest Series (Bring Your Own Bike) that inspired riders of all ages.  The relationships built with new riders across the Midwest were priceless!
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

 

Check out the feature article about us published by Purpose to Play!http://www.google.com/amp/purpose2play.com/young-bmx-riders-in-the-midwest-flock-to-nowear-for-big-airs-support/amp/?client=safari

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone has the financial means to donate, but you can help by sharing the word!  Share our cause on Facebook, Instagram or just on the street!  Indiegogo also has share tools you can use.  Anything you can do will help our cause! 

 

Who is Nowear BMX?

We are Karl and Carrie Hinkley - the founders of Nowear BMX and the Nowear Compound.  The Compound is at our home on six acres in the middle of nowhere.  We reside here with our three children, who are all involved in BMX and share in the love of the sport.  Karl has been a part of the world of BMX for over 30 years and  we want to be able to provide opportunities and community for the youth in Nebraska and anyone passing through.  BMX truly is family for us.

story:
What Exactly is Creative Grounds DC?

Creative Grounds DC is a community space for teaching, producing and showcasing art while serving ethically sourced coffee and good eats. A true community gathering space, Creative Grounds DC goes beyond the traditional coffee bar model to include a unique and fulfilling arts education program for kids, studio rental and exhibition space. Located in the Bloomingdale neighborhood of Washington, DC, the space is a 2,000 sq ft facility that will serve as the go-to destination for art-related activities in the nation’s capital.

We invite YOU to join us on our journey to create spaces where we embrace and celebrate creativity and community.

 

Proud parents and founders of Creative Grounds DC, Kenn & Asmara, with their children, Khalab & Samra 

 

Why a community arts space?

Bloomingdale has been a great place to raise our kids. It is vibrant, eclectic and friendly.  As residents, parents to two active children, and art lovers, we are happy to see the increasing number of families and artists making Bloomingdale home. The only missing piece: more indoor organized activities for children. ANC representative and Bloomingdale Civic Association Second Vice President, Bertha Holliday agrees with us. She states,

“Creative Grounds DC will address two of Bloomingdale’s major needs: more enriching organized activities for Bloomingdale's increasing child population and a formal permanent space for galvanizing and promoting Bloomingdale's unique arts and cultural communities.”  

It was with this mind that we thoughtfully considered how best to give back to the community we love. Creative Grounds DC was born.

Our new home! 1822 North Capital Street, NW, Washington, DC

 

 

Contributing to the DC Arts Scene

As you can see on this map, we’re centered in one of the historically creative communities in DC, with the famed Howard Theatre, U Street Music Hall, Phillips Collection, Adams Morgan, and Civil War Museum all less than two miles from us. Creative Grounds DC will be a great addition and we are ready to contribute to this storied history. But we are going to need your help!

 

We believe that art is healing, transformative, and for children, the developmental benefits of arts practice serve as the basis for all learning and emotional growth. We’ve already started developing a pretty cool arts curriculum highlighting famous art movements throughout history. Children will get the opportunity to explore Pop Art, Impressionism and the work of the Color School of Washington, to name a few, in fun and developmentally appropriate ways. With program names like the Happy Scribblers and Tiny Artists in Residence, it’s sure to be fun for all. We are passionate about art programs for children because we have witnessed the successful use of art practice in children with self-regulation challenges, emotional trauma and developmental delays.  Children are encouraged to express their frustrations and feelings through a paint brush, drawing, meditation, and/or yoga.

 

Khalab, a young, budding artist

 

Samra's self-expression through art

 

Providing an Affordable Space for Local Artists

Keep in mind the rapidly changing city of Washington, DC and it’s effect on affordable spaces. The development boom has meant an increase in the cost of living, less affordable spaces and limited options. For artists, it makes living and working in DC challenging. Creative Grounds DC is dedicated to providing a platform for artists and art enthusiasts to practice and showcase their craft without the burden of high-priced fees. We also understand that art and art practice can be expensive so we have promised to never turn an artist or child away because of limited resources. Simply put, Creative Grounds DC is our way of supporting our neighborhood and city with thoughtful reflection on the role of creativity, learning, and expression in community building.

 

At Mural Jam, a community art project sponsored by Albus Cavus, local artists spent a day painting a massive mural on a concrete retaining wall behind the Rhode Island Avenue Shopping Center in Washington, DC. Photo by Kevin Harber

 

Supporting Local Small Business

This project has also given us the opportunity to support local business. We’re working with locally owned and operated specialty coffee roaster, Nagadi Coffee Roaster, a company whose mission is producing a great quality product, that empowers growers, and improves their lives. We’re equally proud to work with women of the Crossroads Community Food Network, a micro-enterprise training program for food business entrepreneurs. We’ve been very intentional about who we work with because every individual that is part of this initiative is also a part of this canvas we’re painting called Creative Grounds DC. It’s important for us to weave our social activism, belief in collaboration, and service into this business. To say that this project has given us so much joy is an understatement. We have taken all that we love, including our interests, hobbies and most importantly, the values that we hold dear and created a business that will make us all proud.

 

Serving you the best in specialty coffee to start your day

 

 

Why Indiegogo?

Exposure to art enhances everyone’s lives. When talking with neighbors, artists, bloggers and our very own children, we’ve repeatedly heard that people want and need more indoor enrichment activities for children and families. Add to that the desire to have fewer bars, restaurants, and clubs, we believe Creative Grounds DC is a great addition to the Bloomingdale neighborhood the District as a whole.  As a supporter of the arts community here in DC, we strive to provide opportunities to create, connect and engage with art and other artists.  With YOUR support, we can do this and so much more!

 

 

What will your contribution support?

We are committed to providing everyone access to Creative Grounds DC through the use of the space as a platform to showcase their work and to enable their participation in all Creative Grounds DC programming. Art supplies, the art library and the Hearts and Arts program (arts organizations working with underserved communities) will all benefit from your support. While Creative Grounds DC is a privately funded endeavor, it is through individual donations that we are able to ensure the diversity and access to programs, essential build out, equipment, and supplies. More than this, your support is proof of concept that the arts are vitally important and add value to our community.

 

 

Werk, Werk, Werk, Werk

In just the last 6 months, we have immersed ourselves in the work of becoming Creative Grounds DC by:

  • Obtaining an LLC, registered agent and other legal documents;
  • Personally vetting and hosting behind the scene openings for potential suppliers, vendors, strategic partners and art educators;
  • Attending cupping and food tastings; We wanted to offer you the best coffee and food experience. You are going to LOVE the coffee and food.
  • We received mentorship from the good people at Keffa Coffee, Keren Restaurant and Anna Banana on how to make this project a success (Thank you Ladies!);
  • Securing a brand strategist, videographer and accountant.  It takes a village, right?
  • Scheduling barista training and art classes--you know just to brush up and learn new skills. and there’s still so much more to do...

 

Kenn & Asmara

 

Why We're So Passionate About Creative Grounds DC

4,475 days, 2 children, 3 continents, Multiple jobs, 2 homes and 14 birthdays later, Asmara and Kenn are the faces behind Creative Grounds DC.

ASMARA: What’s most important here is that you know just much I LOVE great coffee and that art sets my soul on fire. I know, pretty intense, but it is true. Art is awareness and I am drawn to artwork that speaks to important social concerns, issues of identity, politics, and culture. Considering just how heavy these themes are, without an outlet, strong feelings are buried, unexplored and unresolved. It is the realization that Art is a necessary vehicle for identifying and expressing one’s self to facilitate true expression, healing, and transformation, and if done with good intentions, a shared humanity.

Art is a language that everyone understands; a home that everyone belongs to. So, it makes sense that I create a place that strives to be inclusive, healing, transformative and humane.

In my previous life,  I was a nonprofit executive working with immigrants and refugees. Let it be known I am a proud first-generation Eritrean-American. My parents immigrated to the US from Eritrea, East Africa. Professionally, my greatest honor has been working with underserved children and immigrant and refugee youth. Asmara loves the kids! I’ve chaired the boards of arts and governmental organizations. My greatest honor is being the mom of two amazing kiddos, who love art and understand that mommy does not rise until the Bialetti espresso maker begins percolating.

Coffee is right up there with my love of art! Ethically sourced, Yirgacheff happens to be my all time favorite. That said, I am hearing great things about coffee from Kigali and Uganda. Ok, let me focus. My maternal grandfather was a coffee cultivator. He lived most of his life in the coffee plantations of his village in Eritrea. And, while Eritrea does not export much coffee, shipments often found their way to DC and on to my mother’s table. And, so it began. The preparation and ritual of it all is bewitching. The smell of roasting beans permeated our hair and clothes. That fragrance should truly be bottled and sold! While I can not promise to do that, I can offer you the next best thing: ethically sourced, specialty roasted coffee at Creative Grounds DC. I am telling you, you are going to love it!

 

 

KENN: I am an eighth generation Washingtonian. I was raised in the Eastland Gardens and Brookland communities. It was there that I developed my sense of worth, work ethic, and pride. Raised by an art collector/community organizer and educator I was intimately aware of both the beauty and ugliness surrounding us. My upbringing gave me the sense that I could change my reality. That life should be aspirational. So I chose to pursue a career in real estate helping first-time home buyers and low-income families purchase homes.

Good business is not simply about making money it’s about changing lives and filling gaps or voids where they exist. Creative Grounds DC will do exactly this. As you have read above, we need more enriching indoor activities for kids and our arts community deserves more support. Without businesses like Creative Grounds DC, the voids or gaps persist. This project is our way of being solution-oriented.  We simply need your support. As Asmara noted, we are parents to two amazing kids and it has always been our mission to expose them to the art world, be it through performance art, visual media, or writing.

In fact, we have seen the benefits of art practice in our own daughter, who when frustrated or struggling with self-regulation, will go to her art journal to find peace through doodling.  We love Creative Grounds DC and we think you will too.

 

 

What does it take to open a hybrid arts studio + coffee bar?

So we have already financially invested roughly half of the startup costs for Creative Grounds DC. But we still need your support. Your contributions will go toward the following:


 

 

There are Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word: Use Indiegogo's share tools, use the hashtag #creativegroundsdc and tag us! We're on Facebook, Instagram, and Pinterest @CreativeGroundsDC and on Twitter and Periscope @CreativeGrndsDC. Call your friends and tell them about the awesome perks they can receive for supporting the arts (and great coffee).
 

Write about us: If you write for the media or have a blog focused on children, parenting, family, the arts, coffee, DC or business/entrepreneurship, contact us at info@creativegroundsdc.com and let’s create epic content.

 

 

Thank you for your support!

We can’t wait to invite you into our new space. Creative Grounds DC: where arts, community & coffee meet.

Let’s create something extraordinary,

Kenn & Asmara

(in other circles, known as the KAKS-Kenn, Asmara, Khalab and Samra)

My name is Terea McQueen, I am a 22 year old philadelphia native and currently a full-time cosmetology student at Jean Madeline Aveda Institute. Feel Good, Look Good, is essentially derived from the unique tools and beliefs that my school thrives on, That when people feel good, they look good, We don't just aim to provide our guests with great service but a memorable experience. Feel Good, Look Good will mock the same values. Raising the funds for this campaign will not only allow me to reach the senses of others but to continue what I was taught after graduation and obtaining my cosmetology license July 2017.

This business will be simply to cater to the hardest working women, who just need that Sweet Escape after a long work day, or week. To supply services and products that assess our guests needs, by being able to enhance their physical appearance, giving them a great experience, a boost of confidence, and feeling vibrant and refreshed, mentally and physically.

The goal is to raise $20,000. The funding will go to product research, product development, marketing, Advertising, website, the launch and possibly the physical location of the salon/store front. 

We will  set ourselves apart from other beauty salons that may offer only one or two types of service.  We do plan to offer our clients pampering retreats, rare specials that cannot be turned down, as well as loyalty and referral discounts, ELITE rewards program,  and promote health and better dieting along the way.

Our desire is to have no salon similar to us; we do not intend to compete. Our biggest aim is to please, as we desire to give our guest the recurring luxurious experience that denotes our "Look good, feel good" proverb.

Our business atmosphere will be a relaxing one where clients can kick back and be pampered. Liquid refreshments and relaxers will be offered to clients as they enter for service and in some areas of the salon will contain Entertainment while other areas will offer soft serene sounds and dim lighting, creating therapeutic enjoyment and a temporary escape.

Even if the goal is not met, It will still go to starting this project.

Please feel free to promote this campaign and help spread the word, about feel good, look good. And join us as we begin the start of something new.

story:
Hi there! We're Hidden Hive Meadery, a San Diego based start up planning on bringing you the best mead you have ever tried. 

What is Mead?

Mead (/ˈmiːd/; archaic and dialectal "medd", "Meath or Meathe") is an alcoholic beverage created by fermenting honey with water, sometimes with various fruits, spices, grains, or hops.

SoCal Style Mead is "Mead" fermented to a respectable 11% ABV and carbonated in a beer style with ambient flavors of all the "sometimes" ingredients just so it tastes great.

 What We Need & What You Get

Starting a meadery is no simple task. Over the past two years we have been researching, planning and finalizing our recipes. We're on the right track we just need your help. 

The funds raised by this Indiegogo will go directly into buying a 10 barrel tank for our custom crush production. We have worked closely with a local winemaker who has agreed to let us put in a tank and start brewing as soon as we're ready. 

That's where you come in! Every donation, as small or as big as you're able will put us one step closer to reaching our goal!

Check out our great perks! We're offering everything from a sticker set which includes a limited edition backer sticker all the way to vouchers for our mead club. You can even be a part of our tasting panels which will be integral in deciding what products get produced on a large scale. The options are (almost) endless!

Risks & Challenges

We would love to ask for more than the 10k we have listed here but we're aware that not everyone is able to donate to a crowdfunding campaign for a business in development.  

If we are unable to reach our goal the next step would be to start much smaller than we're hoping for. That means that growth would take time and our product wouldn't be available at every location we were hoping for. 

One way or the other we are committed to bringing you a great product. We have built up contingency plans for if we don't get the amount of funding we're expecting.  One option is to buy smaller tanks, another is to use plastic fermenters instead of stainless steel. While this isn't perfect by any means, we will still have product to sell by the middle of the year.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help financially we totally understand. Here are a few ways that you could still help us out:

  • Share our Indiegogo with your friends! 
  • Ask your local bars, restaurants and bottle shops to email us. The more buzz we have around out product at launch, the faster we can grow and move in to our own tasting room.
  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. That way once we're up an running you'll be the first to know when you can come and try our mead!

 

Thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign. It's going to be a great year for Hidden Hive and we're excited to share our mead with you!

 

 

*** All vouchers and clubs require age verification upon redemption
